story:
Note: This Indiegogo campaign has ended, but you can still donate!

https://angkorhospital.org/support/donate/

Who we are

Angkor Hospital for Children (AHC) is a non-profit pediatric teaching hospital working in cooperation with the Cambodian Government to provide free, quality care to impoverished children in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Since 1999, AHC has provided over 1,000,000 medical treatments, education to thousands of Cambodian health workers and prevention training to thousands of families. 

What we need 

Our 'show some heart' campaign aims to raise US$70,000 to provide surgery to 3,900 children, including 43 heart surgery patients, during September to December 2013. All money raised will go directly towards the costs of life-changing operations.

In 2010, thanks to strong relationships with surgical teams in Australia, Singapore, Italy and the US, AHC began its Open Heart Surgery Program. Prior to this, there were limited options available for poor families with children who suffered from heart disease in Cambodia. Not only do the visiting teams perform complex heart surgeries, they train our surgeons so that ultimately our Cambodian heart team will be able to perform these operations unaided. 

AHC is a non-profit organisation that relies on donations from people around the world. We realise our goal is big, but we also think peoples' hearts are big. Especially international supporters, like you. 

Impact 

Currently, we have 1,500 heart patients on our waiting list. By helping raise US$70,000, you will allow AHC to continue to provide life-saving surgery to children from poor families, who without your help may die.

So far in 2013 we have performed 7,871 surgeries.  The impact a minor operation can have on a child is huge - but the impact a heart operation can have is endless. They enable our patients to have a happy and healthy life, allowing them to do the simplest of things like play with friends or go to school . Most importantly they enable our patients to live. 

Support

 Support can also come in many ways like donating money, planning a fundraising event, or sharing news to help spread the word.  On December 1, 2013 we even have lovely supporters from around the world running in the Angkor Wat International Half Marathon as part of 'Team Heart'. 

Show some heart and donate today to change a child's life.

story:
**********AS OF OCTOBER 24, 2012**************

WE HAVE RAISED A TOTAL OF $2,099.00 BETWEEN THE WALK AND THIS CAMPAIGN!!!! WE ARE WELL ON OUR WAY!!! THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS!!!

 

THE MARCH FOR THE CURE – ANN’S ANGELS RAISING MONEY FOR THE PURPLE STRIDE FOUNDATION

My brother, sister-in-law and I would first like to thank anyone who has taken the time to log onto this campaign, as it's purpose is not only to raise money to the PURPLE STRIDE PANCREATIC CANCER ACTION NETWORK, but most importantly, to RAISE AWARENESS for pancreatic cancer. 

PURPOSE: TO RAISE A TOTAL OF $5,000.00 ($3,000 through this website and $2,000 through team Ann’s Angel’s through the Purple Stride Foundation) FOR PANCREATIC CANCER AND PRESENT A CHECK IN THE NAME OF ANN’S ANGELS TO THE PURPLE STRIDE PANCREATIC CANCER ACTION NETWORK SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 18, 2012 AT THE BANKATLANTIC CENTER IN SOUTH FLORIDA. ALL FUNDS  COLLECTED THROUGH THIS WEBSITE WILL BE DONATED TO THE PURPLE STRIDE FOUNDATION

 

After browsing many other very worthy campaigns in the health section on this site, it is more apparent than ever that we can make a difference and people want to help!! As you can imagine, cancer affects not only the patient, but everyone around them as well.

 

WHY WE'RE HERE

Our mother was recently diagnosed with pancreatic cancer and the process has been difficult for not only her, but the people who love and care for her. If you don’t know our mother, we can tell you one thing; SHE IS A FIGHTER. Through all the surgeries, doctors’ appointments, treatments, etc., she has maintained a powerful will that goes without parallel. Not to mention, since diagnosed, our mother has elected to be a participant to FIND A CURE FOR PANCREATIC CANCER by engaging in additional medical testing to help find a CURE.

With that in mind, we have put our minds together and decided “if she can do it, so can we!” And so, here we are; myself, my brother and my sister-in-law making a statement that if a Stage IV cancer patient can make a difference for the future, we can do better.

 

HERE’S HOW IT WORKS

We have started a team, “ANN’S ANGELS” for the PURPLE STRIDE PANCREATIC CANCER ACTION NETWORK SOUTH FLORIDA PANCREATIC CANCER WALK which will take place on SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 18, 2012 AT THE BANKATLANTIC CENTER. We understand that not everyone can make it, so if you can’t donate by registering for the walk, please make a contribution here! If you are interested in walking, please click the link below and search by team under “Ann’s Angels” and make your donation by registering for the walk!

http://www.kintera.org/faf/home/default.asp?iev...

You can check up on our progress to see the total funds raised between both campaigns by jumping on this website every few days (although it will be updated daily!)

 

BUT WAIT!!!  HERE’S THE TRUTH AND WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW

  • Pancreatic cancer receives just 2% of the federal cancer research funding budget.
  • There is NO cure and NO early detection method for pancreatic cancer.
  • While the incidence rates have been declining for many cancers, the incidence rate for pancreatic cancer is increasing. Pancreatic cancer is one of the few cancers for which the relative survival rate has not improved substantially in over 40 years.
  • Pancreatic cancer has the lowest relative survival rate of any major cancers.
  • This year, an estimated 43,920 people will be diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in the United States, and approximately 37,390 will die from the disease.
  •  The average life expectancy after diagnosis with metastatic disease is just five to seven months.
  • The National Cancer Institute (NCI) spent an estimated $96.7 million on pancreatic cancer research in 2010. This represents just approximately 2% of the NCI’s approximate $5 billion annual cancer research budget for that year.
  • Pancreatic cancer has the lowest relative survival rate of any major cancers.

WHAT WE NEED

  • $3,000.00 raised through this IndiGoGo campaign
  • $2,000.00 raised OR 58 people for the Purple Stride Walk through team Ann’s Angel’s (search by team)

http://www.kintera.org/faf/home/default.asp?iev...

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!!!

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!!!!!!!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign and pancreatic caner awareness!
  • Check out other campaigns on this site supporting different types of incurable cancers
  • GET EDUCATED AND PASS IT ON

And that’s all there is to it!

So, are you ready to contribute yet?

My family and I would like to thank everyone who has contributed to this well deserved cause and those who have donated directly to the PURPLE STRIDE PANCREATIC CANCER ACTION NETWORK. For more information on future campaigns for Ann's Angel's, email Krisitna at annsangelskristina@yahoo.com See you on SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 18, 2012 AT THE BANKATLANTIC CENTER.

 

Psssssst !! Remember, SPREAD THE WORD!! See you at the finish line!

story:
Short Summary

Since 32 year old carol keeps getting turned down by state and insurance its now in our hands, hearts, and conceince to keep this mother with her kids and husband

my names thomas im a dj and Vp at a NJ based Online Radio station i've talked to carol many times and she is full of life and always positive, loving , fashion minded and caring about the people around her.

this campain is to raise money for ONE Radiation treatment that the doctors have told her she needs STAT She Needs this Treatment Before her  60 DAYS are up or she may never be herself again...

In the Long Run what we are doing here is not just trying to pick up where medicade and NJ healthcare wont...... But to keep this 32 y/o mother with her HUSBAND AND KIDS for a long and full life

 

What We Need

 

  • Money For Medical Treatment and Medicine
  • Tell Others About this And beg them to make a stand and help
  • Write to the state of NJ and Demand Change!!!

The Impact

 

  • This means alot to me because i would never want to see 4 children loose their mother like this they have seen enough with her sick for the past two years .

 

  • This Mother has Done EVERYTHING and Gone EVERYWHERE just to Fight to Live Please Help Keep her with her kids and husband Any little bit will be appriciated

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean YOU can’t help:

  • Write to the state and demand change
  • PLEASE SHARE SHARE SHARE AND USE THE SHARE BUTTONS AND THE BOTTOM TIMES RUNNING OUT!!!

And that’s all there is to it. Thank you for taking the time to read this!!!

story:
Hello Indiegogo!

About Me

  My name is Adam Poland, and I am a 22 year-old college student that currently lives in the small town of Mount Vernon, Texas. I was born on June 17, 1991 in Garland, Texas. I lived there until 2000, when I moved to Mount Vernon, along with my family. All through grade-school, I had an unusual obsession with cars. Everything I read, dreamt, and talked was cars. I put the idea that cars were too expensive into my head, and instead tried sports like skateboarding, BMX-ing, and football throughout my school years. None of these really appealed to me, however. When I graduated high school, I decided that I wanted to do something with cars for the rest of my life. After struggling to find a degree that was right for me for a few years, I decided to become an auto mechanic. As a result, I am attending school as an automotive technician, and will be graduating in May, 2014. I currently have a 4.0 GPA in the field, and will hopefully be graduating with honors. After graduating, I plan on finishing my mechanical engineering degree.

From Beginning to End

  In 2007, I became involved with a group called The Drivers Edge (http://www.thedriversedge.net/), a high performance driving school based out of Mount Vernon. My best friend since sixth grade, Trevor Zimmerman, connected me with this group through his mom, who had married the owner of the company. I began driving with The Drivers Edge, and every instructor that I had told me that I had natural talent behind the wheel of a car. I brushed these comments off and jokingly stated that, "Video games helped I guess.".

  I continued driving with The Drivers Edge, and continually heard these same comments. I finally started to take notice, as did my parents. We decided as a family that it was time to take our first steps into club racing.

  It turns out that getting into club racing was not nearly as easy as one may think. We were given the run-around by multiple people, and were mislead many times. We finally came into contact with a woman named Shannon, who helped us find our way into SCCA Club Racing (Sports Car Club of America,http://www.scca.com/ ).

  2010 rolls around, and we find ourselves at the licensing event at Texas World Speedway for my club racing license in the middle of July. We were dumbfounded as to what we were doing, but were helped along by many of the very friendly people within the world of motorsports. This licensing event consisted of multiple practice races and classroom sessions. After a very hot and tiring weekend, I had my SCCA Club Racing license in my hand, and we had decided that we were going to race in the Spec Miata series of SCCA under the team name of Eastex Motorsports, in a 1991 Mazda Miata.

  The 2010/2011 season was very rough for us, as we were still learning the sport and figuring out how everything worked. I figured out that the competition was very fierce, and that my skills needed further honing that what I had initially thought. I had a few top ten finishes during this season, and fought hard the whole way. Regardless, I ended the season with enough points to compete in the 2011 SCCA National Runoffs at Road America.

  The Runoffs were a completely different story than the National and Regional races I had been attending, and I would be racing them in a new-to-me car, a 1999 Mazda Miata. After learning the car over the week of being at the track, I ended up with a qualifying position of twenty-first. It was not what I was hoping, but I was happy nonetheless. I kept a solid pace, and ended up finishing in tenth place. A top ten finish at my first ever national championship was a big deal to me and my team.

  We went into the 2012 season with much more confidence than we had in the previous season, and we went in ready to go. After multiple team meetings, we decided that we would race with both SCCA and NASA (National Auto Sport Association, http://www.nasaproracing.com/), with the latter being out preference.  We had formed a team by this point that consisted of myself, my mom (Kathy Poland), my dad (Tim Poland), my sister (Leah Poland), and my friend Trevor Zimmerman. Midway through this season, I met a girl who was brought into the team, as we started dating. Her name is Lindsey Davis. This season ended up being a very good season for us, as I ended up third in overall points, and third in the Teen Mazda Challenge.

  The 2013 season is underway, and it is the best yet. My skills, as well as the teams, have increased dramatically, and we are all still together. I have won multiple races this season thus far, and won the Teen Mazda Challenge for the Texas region with a full sweep in points. I am currently third in overall points, but am going for first, as there are still two races left, and the points are close. We plan on attending the NASA National Championship on September 7th.

  Teen Mazda Challenge 

  You may have noticed that I mentioned the Teen Mazda Challenge a couple of times, and may be wondering what it is. It is a program that was developed by Mazda for "teens" aged 13-22 that gives them an opportunity to make it into the pro ranks. A winner from each NASA region is chosen to compete in a specialized event that is worth $75,000 for them to put toward pro racing in the Playboy MX-5 Cup Series (http://www.mx-5cup.com/2012/).

  The Next Goal/Proposal   

  Even though I won the Teen Mazda Challenge, I am still trying to figure out which way to go, and I am leaning towards Pirelli World Challenge (PWC,http://www.world-challenge.com/ ) versus the MX-5 Cup if I can fund it. I believe that this would be a great series to go with for me and my team, as there is national televised coverage of the international series on NBC Sports Network, versus none with the MX-5 Cup. PWC is a much more expensive series than the MX-5 Cup, but the recognition we would get as a team would be so much more.

  The car we are looking into running is a 2012 Mazda MX-5 in the Touring Car class. A typical season in Pirelli World Challenge costs around $400,000 for everything for a full year. I am sending out sponsorship proposals to companies and trying to raise money to be able to afford it. I've always believed that if you put your mind to it, you can do it. 

  World Challenge Vision offers a marketing sponsorship package thst includes the following:

- One set of four PWC Pirelli Racing Slicks

-90 seconds of in car coverage

-90 seconds of NBCSports/WCTV televised broadcast coverage

-One four color full page ad in the World Challenge Fan Guide

-4 tickets to each race weekend

-50 fan guides

-One Pirelli World Challenge/Manufacturer flag that is used for pre-race ceremonies

-Custom hi resolution 27" x 20" print of the years action shots for driver/team or sponsor

-Custom produced video for your driver/team/sponsor with 2 DVD's and a link to a host site

  The funds raised from this campaign will be used to pay for this sponsorship package. It is a $94,400 value, that is available for $6,500 before season beginning. This would save us a huge amount of money off of the typical $400,000 cost.

  I ask you, people of Indiegogo, to please help my team and I realize our dream of getting into pro racing. We would love to be able to go into the pro ranks knowing that we were backed by those who want to see success. I have set the number of days that this campaign will be going through to thirty-three, as this is my race number, and what myself and my team consider a lucky number. Any type of donation to the cause is welcomed. If you know someone within the motorsports world, or someone willing to help, put this proposal out there to them!

  Thank you so much for your time and consideration, and we hope to be seeing you at future races if you decide to attend.

Thank you again,

  Adam Poland and the Eastex Motorsports team

-4 tickets to each race weekend
-50 fan guides
-One Pirelli World Challenge/Manufacturer flag that is used for pre-race ceremonies
-Custom hi resolution 27" x 20" print of the years action shots for driver/team or sponsor
-Custom produced video for your driver/team/sponsor with 2 DVD's and a link to a host site
  The funds raised from this campaign will be used to pay for this sponsorship package. It is a $94,400 value, that is available for $6,500 before season beginning. This would save us a huge amount of money off of the typical $400,000 cost.
  I ask you, people of Indiegogo, to please help my team and I realize our dream of getting into pro racing. We would love to be able to go into the pro ranks knowing that we were backed by those who want to see success. I have set the number of days that this campaign will be going through to thirty-three, as this is my race number, and what myself and my team consider a lucky number. Any type of donation to the cause is welcomed. If you know someone within the motorsports world, or someone willing to help, put this proposal out there to them!
  Thank you so much for your time and consideration, and we hope to be seeing you at future races if you decide to attend.
Thank you again,
  Adam Poland and the Eastex Motorsports team

story:
What is MicroGreens?

MicroGreens is an innovative program that works with schools and non-profit organizations to educate children and low-income families about how to make healthy choices based on a government-supplemented food budget.  This fundraiser is for the  Imagine Southeast Public Charter School chapter of MicroGreens. 

Our class consists of a lead fellow and three assistant fellows to teach 8 cooking classes for ten 5th and 6th grade students at the Imagine Southeast Public Charter School in Washington, D.C. MicroGreens fellows showcase how anyone can shop for, prepare, and enjoy a healthy meal based on a total budget of $3.50 per meal per family of four. For more information visit the MicroGreens website. 

Each lesson enhances student’s culinary expertise and gives them the confidence to use those skills at home, from food preparation like roasting and braising to kitchen safety and team work.

How you can help:

As part of our end of semester Top Chef Competition, we are in need of ten crock pots to give to each student as part of their graduation. We would also like to fund raise enough money to provide additional useful kitchen equipment to each kid as part of their culminating experience in MicroGreens. Your donation will help us reach our goal of providing each kid with the supplies they need to continue a healthy lifestyle. 

The Impact

  • MicroGreens was developed to help combat obesity in the U.S. and teach families how to enjoy healthy food on a budget, city by city, one meal at a time.
  • In 2012 nearly 20% of Americans will apply for the SNAP Program (formerly known as the Food Stamp Program) while 40% of our nation’s food is wasted.  Food education is at the center of America’s health issues, and continues to be essential to improving the future of our nation’s youth.

story:
Ariella's Story

In December 2011 Ariella was diagnosed with Lyme disease.  This was after 13 years of unexplained illnesses and misdiagnoses.  One main illness brought this whole thing to a head.  In August 2011 Ariella had a Laparoscopy and it was discovered she had a very large cyst on her left Fallopian Tube.  It was removed and things were supposed to get better.  Ariella did not get better as she started her senior year in September.  She became more sick and there were days when she could not stand, walk or hold a pencil.  The pain was unbearable for her.  She had extreme joint/muscle pain, heart palpitations, twitching muscles, extreme headaches, numbness, poor balance, burning and stabbing sensations throughout her body, and many more symptoms.  She missed many days of school.  Fortunately Ariella's Algebra teacher knew of Lyme disease and insisted that Ariella get tested.  It turned out that Ariella did have Lyme disease. 

About Lyme Disease

This was all very confusing, frustrating and scary.  To find out that there were 2 types of Lyme disease (acute and chronic) and that only acute was recognized by the IDSA (Infectious Diseases Society of America).  Due to the IDSA Guidelines, Chronic Lyme or Late Stage Lyme is not recognized by the medical community and is dismissed.  It all comes down to medical establishments being corrupted by corporate interests and being linked with big pharma and insurance companies.  You can watch the documentary "Under Our Skin" and learn more.  Acute Lyme is treated with a short course of antibiotics but if it isnt caught, it becomes a whole different story.  A deadly bacterium that takes over the whole body.  It's often compared to Syphilis due to the spirochete form.  Lyme spreads throughout the entire body and has the capacity to hide from antibiotic treatments, your own antibodies and immune system.  It goes into your heart, eyes, joints and brain and protects itself with a shield (bio-film). 

Treatment

Fortunately there are many supplements and herbs that can help break down this bio-film while being treated with aggressive antibiotic therapy.  We did find a naturopath who is Lyme literate and he has been treating Ariella with antibiotics for almost 10 months now.  The other part of the treatment is many supplements.  One of the supplements help break down the bio-film so the antibiotics have a better chance at killing the Lyme bacteria.  She takes probiotics to help her fight Candida from long term antibiotic use, and many other supplements to help replace important vitamins and minerals that are depleted while on antibiotics.  

These supplements cost about $400 a month and they are not covered by insurance.  We do not have the money for these supplements anymore and we have depleted all of our financial resources.  Your help is greatly needed in this situation.  We are trying to keep her from having a PICC line (tubing that goes in the arm and travels to just above the heart)  This is for intravenous antibiotics.  If we can continue the supplements with the oral antibiotics, we have a better chance at beating this.  

I am very proud to say that Ariella did graduate from high school while battling this horrible disease.  Watching my daughter walk across that stage was one of the happiest moments in my life.  It took a lot of help and understanding from her teachers but she did it.  We appreciate any help we can get so this beautiful and talented young lady can get on with her life and do the wonderful things that she was intended to do.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just cant make a financial contribution and we completely understand this.  There are other ways you can help:

  • Spread the word about this campaign to help Ariella continue treatment.
  • Be aware of ticks when you are out and about.  Be very vigilant and if you are bitten by a tick, get treated immediately.
  • Educate yourself about Lyme disease so that you may help others.  You never know when you might be able to help someone. If Ariella's Algebra teacher had never told Ariella to get tested for Lyme we would still be trying to figure out what was wrong with her.

More Information About Lyme Disease 

www.underourskin.com

www.LymeDiseaseAssociation.org

www.lymedisease.org

https://www.facebook.com/LymeChick?ref=ts

story:
Preventing and reversing cardiovascular disease with an all-natural, non-pharmaceutical, simple amino-acid supplement. Product is supported by over 80,000 independent studies and Nobel Prize winning research.

Project Summary

 

OUR WHY?

I believe we are fortunate, when if at some point in our lives we realize, that we have been given an opportunity to serve a higher purpose. We at Build-Win 4 Life feel we have been given just such an opportunity! Over one million Americans will die from Cardio Vascular disease in the next 12 months. That is like a tragic 9/11 happening each and every day!

What was shocking to me as we researched this project was: 1) Cardiovascular disease is the # 1 cause of death in America 2) More women than men die each year from Cardiovascular disease 3) Female deaths from Cardiovascular disease dwarf all other causes of death (including breast cancer) and 4) Deaths from Cardiovascular disease are greater than the NEXT 9 LEADING causes of death in America COMBINED!  The sad part is it doesn't have to be that way! The amino acid L-Arginine when taken in combination with other anti-oxidants and vitamins is proven to increase Nitric Oxide (NO) in our blood stream. Dr. Louis Ignarro won the 1998 Nobel Prize for medicine for his ground breaking research of NO in our system. His research determined that sufficient NO can prevent and even reverse hardening of the arteries, elevated cholesterol levels and hyper-tension (high blood pressure) among many other health benefits.

Folks, let’s stop believing that the pharmaceutical industry has a “pill for every ill”. In most cases, engineered drugs only "mask" the symptoms and never address the CAUSE. NOTE: We don't recommend stopping any medications, we encourage supplementing with this amazing product, then when your symptoms are improved, your Doctor will likely ask how and then suggest that you no longer need your blood pressure and/or cholesterol medications! It is documented to have happened tens of thousands of times! Your contribution large or small will go a long way towards helping us improve people’s health!

 

OUR PRODUCT

Our daily supplement was formulated by Dr. Harry Elwardt. Dr. Elwardt is a Naturopathic Doctor, Master Herbalist, Certified Nutritional Counselor, PhD in Health and Nutrition and the author of “Let’s Stop The # 1 Killer of Americans Today!”.

Over 84,000 medically published, peer reviewed, independent clinical tests dating back over 30 years have proven that L-Arginine converts to Nitric Oxide in our blood vessels and increased Nitric Oxide will help:

  • Lower Blood Pressure
  • Lower Cholesterol
  • Improve Diabetes
  • Improve Sexual Function
  • Reduce Blood Clots& Strokes
  • Improve Wound Healing
  • Improve Kidney Function
  • Improve Memory
  • Improve Sleep
  • Increase Energy

It is a pretty safe bet that most all of us see ourselves on that list somewhere.

Please take a moment to review the attached document; “22 Reasons to Supplement with Arginine”.

 

WHO NEEDS TO SUPPLEMENT?

While proteins help our bodies naturally produce Nitric Oxide (NO), with the nutrient deficient food chain that is now our reality, the body simply does not produce enough NO to provide all of the amazing benefits that NO provides.           L-Arginine taken as a daily supplement, boosts our body’s production of NO. Cardiovascular symptoms and diabetes are showing up in our population, more and more, at alarmingly young ages. We believe that almost everyone in America over the age of 20 should be supplementing with L-Arginine.

 

CONSUMER AWARENESS

While Build-Win4Life is certainly not the only company marketing this type of product, it is our intent to be the largest messenger for this product and its health benefits. Our customers quickly become passionate about supplementing with Arginine and begin to tell everyone they know and love. It is this passion that will help us to reach a massive market. Our customers can, and most do, become Preferred Customers and couple their passion with an income (through our Referral Rewards Program). This combined with the fact that we believe we are the best priced, most nutritionally packed product available today will drive our success!

YOUR CONTRIBUTION

We need to finish some upgrades to our website and our sales tracking software. We also need to create and print additional marketing materials and we desire to re-stock inventory at a volume purchase to allow us to reduce our per unit cost. With our current and projected member/sales growth we feel that this cash infusion will give us the solid foundation necessary to carry our message of good health and improved wealth to the masses!

story:
10 weeks of no drinking and body battering began on 13th January 2014... for anyone that knows me not drinking is a big deal (Motion will not be the same without the Octopus) 

Sunday mornings used to regularly consist of getting in at 8am, now its more likely 3 hours training at the mercy of Phil Allen and Jake O'Hagon - believe me there not soft.

On 22nd March I will take part in a boxing match at the Hand Arena in Clevedon, you can buy tickets at http://zerotoheroboxing.com/buy-tickets/ if you want to witness this.

I'm going to be raising money for a very special little girl in Bristol who needs some help..

Daisy is two years old and has a rare genetic syndrome which is she is currently undergoing genetic testing for, it effects her in many different ways, at the moment she can't say any words and it also affects her physically. 

Daisy also has a chronic sleep disorder which means she constantly wakes during the night which is why we need to fund raise money..

Daisy needs a specialist piece of equipment called a sleep system which will keep her safe during the night and last right through till adulthood, the sleep system costs £7000 but is going to make a massive change to Daisy's life.

`Daisy is the happiest little girl and we would appreciate it very much` - Stephanie, Daisy's mum.

Please all dig deep in your pockets to support the cause of this beautiful little girl.

Cheers in advance
Brad

story:
Okay, so I had a lame paragraph here before, but this is actually starting to turn more serious considering it's already 30% there (as of Week 1).

Here's the deal. I just got into trail running at the end of May when the last snows fell in Denver (there were actually a few snow days in June I had to take a break from). And then I actually started being consistent and training at the end of July.


This fundraiser helped me run my first half marathon - The Black Squirrel Trail Half Marathon. And with 5 weeks of training, I did it and I did AWESOME.


So since I came back from my 6-month trip in Africa back in January 2013, I have been unemployed and very depressed. I decided working out and trail running to get out of the house would be the best option and it really has helped.


But the best part of running is going to races and feeling a sense of comradery I've longed for my whole life (maybe from being an only child). But races are EXPENSIVE. Especially now that I'm running halfers and longer. I've considered just running them without registering, but c'mon that's not fair for anyone.



TL;DR: If you've got a job and even just a few bucks to spare, help this poor girl out having the only fun I've had in 8 months. Trail races. I'll even GoPro some and do some funny requests if you've got them



**Also, Jake the Photographer is making a short video of my running success and apparently I've said some good things that are motivational and inspiring. I'm sure these funds will also help him and the video will be viewable by early October (cross your fingers, and if you want to yell at him, his website is here: www.jakebelvin.com)

story:
Our Story:

Eric and I discovered over the years, we should have met numerous times but the fates decided we weren’t supposed to be together until 2004. Our first date was one I will never forget, Eric took me to the driving range. He nestles behind me in order to show me how to swing the club and in true “caveman” style he hit me over the head. And I was his from that moment on.

We knew from the very beginning children were our future but we had a cloud of doubt hanging over our heads. When I was 15 years old I was diagnosed with Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome (PCOS) which would make it extremely difficult for me to conceive naturally. But we were optimistic, we knew it would happen.

November 13, 2010 Eric and I tied the knot and made the executive decision to seek medical help for my infertility, immediately. We had saved some money over the years, thinking we would only need to take a pill or two and we would have our baby. No such luck, after a year of fertility treatments, ranging from Clomid to injectables, we still were not able to conceive. It was devastating to the both of us. We had been so confident that we would overcome the odds that failure never even crossed our minds.

The next step is IVF, the doctor has told us that I am a great candidate for it but as we all know, this procedure is pretty expensive. I understand times are fiscally rough for everyone and we thank you so much for even considering helping us.

When asked what we dream of most our answer is always, "to be a parent."

Please help Eric and I realize our dream.

 

Where your donation will go...

Here's a breakdown of the testing and procedures your donation will go towards in helping make our dream of becoming parents a reality:

  • Fertility Medications
  • Cycle Stimulation, Monitoring and Ultrasounds
  • Egg retrieval with Anesthesia
  • ICSI (Intra Cytoplasmic Sperm Injection)
  • Assisted Egg Hatching
  • Embryo Transfer
  • Laboratory Screening and Pregnancy Testing

story:
Frank

     Frank.  He is that friend that is always there for you. Always positive.  He even threw a bbq and cooked for all his friends in Philly before his move to NY.  Thats when his bike got stolen.  It was really no individual's fault - everyone was there. Thats why we want to give something back to Frank for being such a great friend and a little retribution for having something taken away from him that he loved.

The $

    Frank just purchased this bike.  Bianchi.  Prized posession.  So much time and effort went into finally getting this bike after his last bike was stolen, just to have it happen again.  We are estimating the bike (and upgrades) came to about $600. 

    Having a bike stolen is awful.  I have had it done twice, and both times I flipped.  Frank was very calm and collected about it (having been in the middle of his going away party), but we know he is devistated.  If we could give him back anything in retribution - anything -  I feel like we would be able to restore everyones faith in humanity just a little.

I know what you are thinking.

     Why help him get a new bike?  I've had someting stolen from me, and no one gave me money or got it back for me.  Sometimes it does happen though.  Who knows, next time it could happen to you and then someone will help you out.
 
    I feel like this is a realistic goal.  Especially since Frank is a social butterfly and has lots of great friends who love him :) Please help out! No matter what the amount, anyhthing will be appreciated.  It would also be a great send-off for Frank.  So that hopefully his last memories of Philly won't be him having his bike stolen.
story_txt:
Frank
     Frank.  He is that friend that is always there for you. Always positive.  He even threw a bbq and cooked for all his friends in Philly before his move to NY.  Thats when his bike got stolen.  It was really no individual's fault - everyone was there. Thats why we want to give something back to Frank for being such a great friend and a little retribution for having something taken away from him that he loved.

The $
    Frank just purchased this bike.  Bianchi.  Prized posession.  So much time and effort went into finally getting this bike after his last bike was stolen, just to have it happen again.  We are estimating the bike (and upgrades) came to about $600. 
    Having a bike stolen is awful.  I have had it done twice, and both times I flipped.  Frank was very calm and collected about it (having been in the middle of his going away party), but we know he is devistated.  If we could give him back anything in retribution - anything -  I feel like we would be able to restore everyones faith in humanity just a little.


I know what you are thinking.
     Why help him get a new bike?  I've had someting stolen from me, and no one gave me money or got it back for me.  Sometimes it does happen though.  Who knows, next time it could happen to you and then someone will help you out.
 
    I feel like this is a realistic goal.  Especially since Frank is a social butterfly and has lots of great friends who love him :) Please help out! No matter what the amount, anyhthing will be appreciated.  It would also be a great send-off for Frank.  So that hopefully his last memories of Philly won't be him having his bike stolen.

story:
On November 4th, the YMCA of Dutchess and Eastern Orange (YMCA DEO) suffered devastating damage at its Camp Robbins facility. Smith Lodge, the only building capable of providing school year programming on the site, burned to the ground.

Camp Robbins serves more than 2,000 children and families each year. The YMCA DEO provides more than $60,000 in scholarships and financial aid to ensure that all families have access to quality, educational and safe summer and school year activities.

Smith Lodge was erected in the 1980’s as a home for our youngest campers. It was winterized during the 1990’s to provide a facility for our programs and other community groups to utilize the camp throughout the year. Among the many programs the YMCA holds at Smith Lodge over the winter is Adventure Camp, which provides full day camp activities on school breaks and holidays so that parents can continue to work.  The YMCA had been in the process of applying for a license to use Smith Lodge as a before and after school site to meet the increasing needs of families in the district (the YMCA of DEO currently runs such programs 15 other sites around the region).

The Camp is used by various community groups to meet their program needs including the Boy and Girl Scouts, the Bruderhoff Community, Junior League, many local religious groups, Big Brother Big Sisters, the Air National Guard, Gay/Straight Alliance, orientation for Marist College, SUNY New Paltz, Mount St Mary’s College, and many others.

Our History

Camping became a cornerstone of YMCA programming in 1885 when the YMCA started Camp Dudley, America’s first known summer camp program, at Orange Lake, N.Y. The nation’s longest continually operating camp, its aim was to provide children with a positive developmental experience through making new friends, building confidence and growing in self-reliance.

In 1957, the Camp Orange opened its second location, Camp Isis, a day camp companion for children too young to participate in sleep-away camp at the original site down the road in Walden, NY. In the 1960’s the camp was renamed to become Camp Robbins. YMCA’s Camp Robbins has continued to grow and serve tens of thousands of families from Orange, Dutchess, Ulster and surrounding counties.

From its historic beginnings to today, Camp Robbins and the YMCA of Dutchess and Eastern Orange have been dedicated to working side-by-side with our neighbors to make sure that everyone, regardless of age, income or background, has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

The YMCA of Dutchess and Eastern Orange has been listening and responding to our communities’ most critical social needs for 160 years. Whether developing skills or emotional well-being through education and training, welcoming and connecting diverse demographic populations, or building healthier communities by building collaborations, the Y fosters the care and respect all people need and deserve.

The YMCA will rebuild at Camp Robbins so that future generations can learn the core values that we believe are vital to empowering their future - Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility  helping them to be caring and competent adults who are positive contributors to their community.

We humbly ask for your assistance in helping us to do so.

While we know that insurance will cover a good deal of the expense, there are upgrades to the building - to ensure that it will need the current and future needs for camp and the community- that will not be covered. Every dollar we raise in support of rebuilding will help enhance the services we can provide.

How your gift changes lives

Each year, thousands of children's lives are impacted as a result of Camp Robbins and its programs. Here are just a few examples from the past summer:

•One little boy with severe autism who wasn’t communicating verbally with anyone except his family, was speaking to campers and staff by the end of the season.

 •A young girl who cried inconsolably the first day of camp because her parents were leaving her then cried the last day because she had to leave camp and go back to school.

 •For three years, one young camper could not overcome her fear of climbing the high ropes despite repeated attempts every summer. This summer, with the support and encouragement of camp staff, she made it all the way through the course. She told the staff, “Now I know I can do anything if I just keep trying.”

These moments are just a small glimpse of the big things that can happen in a child’s life because of your support. And that is why we, on behalf of the children we serve and their families, are grateful for your generosity.

Donors like you help make our camp programs possible, ensuring that these kids have an enriching summer experience that focus on four core values: Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility. It also ensures that we can offer scholarships to children and their families who could not, otherwise, afford these life-enhancing activities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to share this page, and the Camp Robbins story with friends, family and others. Our entire community benefits from Camp Robbins. With the support of the community, we can continue to enrich the lives of children for the next 50 years!

story:
The team involved in this project are, Oli McDonough (25) and Roz Inett (28). Oli is a trained professional in the cycle industry, including but not solely mechanics and maintenance. He is an avid cyclist himself and has worked in the industry for just under 7 years, in all retail roles and is currently the Head Mechanic at Halfords in Bromley, Kent. Roz is a mixed media artist, whose work ranges from small story book illustrations to drawings covering whole walls. She is currently working at Coulsdon Sixth Form College, as the Art Technician where she enjoys assisting the staff and students with their practical and creative needs.

Through his work at Halfords, Oli has come into contact with the Charity 'Re-Cycle', who ship unwanted and used bicycles to seven countries in Africa. There they help to support local welfare, education and state of living through their partnerships with schools, villages and workshops (www.re-cycle.org). Through this connection Oli and Roz formulated a project in which they would travel to Africa, and volunteer at one the schemes or businesses that are receiving the bicycles from Re-Cycle. The main aim is to take a comprehensive package of professional tools to Africa, to donate to one of the projects set up there, and to pass on skills and experience to the mechanics and locals working with them.

The project they have chosen to support is Ability Bikes, in Koforidua, Ghana (www.abilitybikes.org). This shop receives bikes from Re-Cycle, and a similar charity from America 'Bikes Not Bombs', and the team of mechanics and admin staff at this site, repair and restore the bikes, before selling the bikes to those in their local and surrounding communities. All of the  staff there are affected by various health and mobility issues, namely Polio and it's life long effects. As such the staff there are empowered with specific job training and responsibility, and sustainable economic opportunities.

The funding required for this project is only going to be put towards tools and maintanence supplies for Ability Bikes, and none shall be put towards any travel expenses, or any other personal uses by the team involved. The money that you can help to provide will directly help those who need it most, and not the team travelling out to deliver them. Through workshops and Oli's experience as a mechanic, these tools will be put to full use and value, and it is this personal involvement that makes this donation so sustainable and valuable.

Oli's experience within the cycle industry, and his knowledge and skills as a bicycle mechanic, will of course be of value to Ability bikes. However it is mainly their extraordinary enthusiasm for cycling, namely it's unquestionable sustainability, that he believes himself and Roz share with the staff at Ability Bikes, that will make this partnership so valuable and welcome.

Throughout the trip Roz is going to be documenting and recording the teams activities and involvement, so that contributors will be able to see directly how they are helping, and the effect their donation has in Ghana. This documentation will not only be of interest to direct contributors, but also to the tens of thousands of people (in the UK alone), who have donated bikes through the 'Halfords Trade In' events, and similar collections that have taken place around the world.


Oli and Roz hope that you can support their project, and they look forward to sharing and creating stories and experiences.

For more information of previous projects to Ghana, see Derek McIntires documentary when he visited there in 2013 http://youtu.be/zQzTFPkthQc

This is the mission statement from the Ability Bikes website

  1. There should be Freedom of Mobility, because mobility is a right for all, thus bicycles and mobility aids give people this freedom in transportation.
  2. A workplace should be free and fair for all persons, with or without disability.
  3. Ability Bikes wants to assure that persons with physical and mobility disability have access to walking and mobility aids for an inclusive society.
  4. We aim to provide high quality and durable bicycles and mobility aids to clients.
  5. We prioritize transparency and accountability throughout the business.
  6. Ability Bikes is a strong advocate against any level of discrimination and believes that everyone should be treated equally.
  7. We believe in continuous education and skills development.
  8. We must work toward the creation of jobs and economic opportunity for all.
  9. We aim to build more international partnerships, as well as nation-wide and local collaborations.
Thank you

story:
Why is it called the TriVibe?

Because it has THREE POWERFUL VIBRATORS in ONE SLEEK DEVICE!

Short Summary

The TriVibe™ is a sex toy that simulates a blow job for a man; and penetration for a woman! 

Using patent pending technology, the TriVibe™ was designed and developed by both Robert Ianuale, founder of nOOkist® (The Internet’s First Sexual History Tracker); and Dr. Justine Marie Shuey, a Board Certified Sexologist and AASECT Certified Sexuality Educator with a Doctorate in Human Sexuality and a Masters in Human Sexuality Education.


The TriVibe™ was developed with the need for not only men to have a better experience and sensation while masturbating; but also for women to also have that same exciting feeling.

Not only that; while other devices are trying to be sold for hundreds of dollars; our initial market price is aimed to be much lower! (Think, around $50)

The initial prototype has already been developed with AMAZING results. We are nearing completion; and need funding to push this to the next level of R&D, manufacturing and distribution.

By contributing to the project; you will help the product to completion quicker; and will help us achieve one of the next milestones in the sex toy market of design.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have already $50,000 of our own money into the project; and are looking to funders to help us create a larger first production run.
  • If you back us; you are guaranteed a TriVibe™, if your backing amount is over $50!
  • You can back us discreetly and anonymously!

The Impact

The TriVibe™ will be the last sex toy you will ever buy; and the first of many amazing orgasms; you’ve never even thought possible.

The technology inside the TriVibe™ will make your whole body tingle; and by helping us get to market quicker; you can be ensured that the product will be amazing.

Not only that; while other devices are trying to be sold for hundreds of dollars; our initial market price is aimed to be much lower! (Think, around $50)

If your funding amount is enough to cover the cost of the product; you are guaranteed a product

Remember, the TriVibe™ has been developed and backed by two industry professionals, including Robert Ianuale, founder of nOOkist® and Dr. Justine Marie Shuey, a Board Certified Sexologist and AASECT Certified Sexuality Educator.

Risks & Challenges

Right now; our challenges are finding an appropriate USA-Based manufacturer to mass produce the TriVibe™. 

However, if we cannot find an appropriate manufacturer, we have the ability to produce the items on our own in our own warehouse.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute and back us; then help get the word out and share our project to the masses!

story:
(Please scroll down for English version.)

Közösségünk 2008 óta kezel betegeket a Jinjutsu nevű japán módszerrel, amellyel akár gyógyíthatatlannak tekintett betegségek esetén is elérhető a teljes gyógyulás. Ilyen például a Crohn-betegség, a szklerózis multiplex, daganatos betegségek, de sokak szenvedését szüntettük már meg a Jinjutsu segítségével, akik lelki gondokkal, cukorbetegséggel, gerincproblémákkal fordultak hozzánk. Gyakorlatilag a legtöbb fizikai és lelki betegség gyógyítható a Jinjutsu által. Módszerünkkel állatokat is kezeltünk már sikerrel. Néhány esetismertetésünket itt találod (görgess egy kicsit lejjebb a konkrét esetekért!), statisztikáink összefoglalóját pedig itt.

Betegeinket adományért kezeljük, mert szeretnénk, hogy a Jinjutsu általi gyógyulás mindenki számára elérhető legyen. Ugyanakkor legtöbb betegünk nem tud kezelésenként akkora adományt adni, amelyből gyógyítóink szerény megélhetése és a kezelőhely fenntartása biztosított lenne. A hozzánk fordulók sokszor munkanélküliek, rokkantnyugdíjasok, vagy olyan súlyos betegek, akik megtakarításaikat orvosokra, gyógyszerekre költötték. Ezért jelképesen száz kezelés árát szeretnénk ebben a kampányban összegyűjteni, amelyből a rászoruló betegek adományait egészítjük ki. Statisztikáink szerint egy beteg átlagosan 20 kezelés után gyógyul meg, így ez a száz kezelés öt rászoruló beteg gyógyulását jelenti.

Hihetetlen öröm látni, amikor valaki egy kezelést követően csillogó szemmel kel fel, vagy amikor beszámol apró javulásokról, a fájdalom csökkenéséről, új dolgokról, amit véghezvitt. Látni, ahogyan napról napra kisimul az arca és szemeibe visszaköltözik az élet. Minden kezelés alatt apró csodák történnek. Mi szeretnénk, hogy ez továbbra is bárki számára elérhető legyen Budapesten, és megköszönünk minden hozzájárulást ehhez! :)


Mire költjük a pénzt?

Most körülbelül 400 ezer Ft-ot szeretnénk összegyűjteni, amelyet gyógyítóink megélhetésére, kezelőhelyeink fenntartására és a Közösség adminisztratív költségeire (bankköltség, könyvelő, fordítás japánról, stb.) szeretnénk költeni. Főállású gyógyítóink egy hónapban körülbelül 170 ezer forintból él(né)nek meg, a kezelőhelyek költségeit is beleszámítva. A kezelésekért adományként kapott összeg ennél alacsonyabb, így ezt fogjuk kiegészíteni a most gyűjtött összeggel, így biztosítva, hogy a Jinjutsu folyamatosan elérhető maradjon a budapestiek számára, gyógyítóink továbbra is főállásban a betegekkel foglalkozhassanak.

Az indiegogo lehetővé teszi, hogy akkor is megkapjuk a gyűjtött pénzt, ha nem érjük el a célként kitűzött összeget (bár ez esetben magasabb jutalékot von le). Minden támogatást a betegkezelésre és az adminisztratív költségekre fogunk fordítani.

Támogatóinknak szeretnénk ajándékokkal kedveskedni, amelyeket az oldal jobb oldalán választhatnak ki. Az ajándékokat május és június folyamán kézbesítjük. Minden támogatónk hozzáférést kap egy bloghoz, amelyben napi munkánkról, az apró csodákról írunk. Május 31-én, a kampányunk utolsó hetében egy pikniket is tartunk, amire szeretettel várunk minden (leendő) támogatót. Itt megismerkedhettek gyógyítóinkkal, feltehetitek kérdéseiteket. A pontos, időpontot, helyszínt később tesszük közzé.

Részletek

Főállású gyógyítónk jobban fizető állásaikat hagyták ott azért, hogy teljes munkaidőben csak a Jinjutsuval foglalkozhassanak. Mivel egy kezelés körülbelül másfél órás, és egy súlyos betegnek akár napi szinten is szüksége lehet a kezelésre, munka mellett nehéz is lenne több beteget kezelni. Nekünk ez lett az életünk, minden nehézség mellett sokkal fontosabb az a szépség, amikor valaki egyszerűen jobban lesz. Bármilyen értelemben. Megkönnyebbül, csökkennek a fájdalmai, javul a mozgása, ki tud mondani valamit, helyreáll az emésztése, megnyugszik. Békésebben távozik tőlünk, és ezt a békét viszi magával a világban.

Jó lenne csak a gyógyításra koncentrálni egész nap, de közösségünk kicsi, és nincs pénzünk szakembereket megfizetni, így a hivatalos ügyeket, a pénzügyeket, az internetes megjelenéseket és a legtöbb adminisztrációt is mi, gyógyítók intézzük.
Sajnos ma Magyarországon egyre inkább megnehezítik a tevékenységünket, egyre többet kell hivatalokba szaladgálnunk, telefonálgatnunk, tárgyalnunk. Korábban buddhista egyházként működtünk, jogosultak voltunk az egyházaknak felajánlható 1% gyűjtésére, ám a jelenlegi kormány megfosztott ezektől a jogainktól és jelenleg csak civil szervezetként gyűjthetjük a felajánlásokat, amivel a korábban gyűjtött összegek töredéke érhető csak el. Ezért kell más finanszírozási formákat keresnünk, hogy kiegészítsük betegeink adományait. Strasbourgban pert indítottunk a kormány ellen egyházi jogaink visszaállítása érdekében, amely eredményeképpen kártérítést ítélt meg nekünk az Európai Bíróság. Ám ennek összegéről nekünk kell megegyeznünk a kormánnyal, kifizetése még sokáig elhúzódhat. Az állam azóta is sok módon nehezíti meg a dolgunkat, legutóbb a közhasznú státuszától is megfosztotta egyesületünket, és a kártérítési perben sem tárgyaltak velünk korrekten. Ez nagyon sok plusz feladatot ró gyógyítóinkra, sőt, még külföldön élő Tanítóinkra is, és rányomja a bélyegét Közösségünk működésére.

Gyógyítóink számára a Jinjutsu szellemi út is, amelyen Tanítóink segítenek minket. Azt tanultuk, hogy minden nehézség egyben lehetőség a fejlődésre, minden, a Közösért tett erőfeszítés visszatér hozzánk, jobbá válhatunk általuk. Így próbáljuk a jelen helyzetet is lehetőségnek tekinteni, próbálunk a magunk részéről mindent megtenni, hogy a betegkezelést fent tudjuk tartani, és erőfeszítéseink által jobb gyógyítókká válhassunk.

Kérünk, ha szeretnéd támogatni munkánkat, ha szeretnéd, hogy ez a gyönyörű módszer továbbra is elérhető legyen a betegek számára Budapesten, akkor támogass minket.

Technikai részletek

Az indiegogo oldalán bárki hozzájárulhat betegeink gyógyulásához, bármekkora összeggel, elektronikus fizetés útján. Mivel forintban ezen az oldalon nem lehet gyűjteni, euróban adtuk meg az adományok összegét. Egy euró körülbelül 300 forintot ér, ezzel lehet számolni. Ha jobb oldalon a "Contribute now" feliratú nagy rózsaszín gombot választod, máris átirányít az adományozási oldalra. Az adományozáshoz be kell jelentkezned, de ezt megteheted facebook profiloddal is. Ha ajándékot is szeretnél választani, akkor itt az "Add perk" feliratra kell kattintani, kiválasztani a megfelelő összeget és a "Continue to payment" gombot megnyomni. Ezt követően az adatok ellenőrzése után a "Go to PayPal" gomb megnyomása átirányít a PayPal oldalára, ahol jobb oldalon választható a PayPal számlával való fizetés, illetve lentebb a bankkártyával történő fizetés. Az oldalak részletes leírását itt találod.

Ahogyan még segíthetsz

Kérünk, hogy oszd meg felhívásunkat ismerőseiddel, hogy minél több emberhez eljussunk. Sok kicsi sokra megy! :) (Ebben segítségedre lehetnek az oldal bal oldalán található gombok.)

Ha adód 1%-áról még nem rendelkeztél, kérünk, ajánld fel Közösségünk számára: Jinjutsu Egyesület, 18333460-1-41.

Köszönjük!

Kérdés esetén...

...írj nekünk itt, az indiegogón, vagy keress meg bennünket a facebookon, illetve e-mailen, telefonon. Elérhetőségeinket megtalálod bemutatkozásaink alatt:

Faragó Ági

Bálintné Marcsi

Monos Vera

Az első kezelés minden gyógyítónknál ingyenes, szeretettel várunk mindenkit, aki szeretné kipróbálni a Jinjutsut.

Minden segítséget nagyon köszönünk!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

English version

Since 2008, our community has been treating patients with a Japanese healing method known as Jinjutsu (meaning "the art of healing"), which can help attainfull recovery even from conditions that are normally regarded as incurable. These include Crohn’s disease, multiple sclerosis, tumors, etc. We have also been able to end the suffering of many who sought our help with psychological issues, diabetes, or spinal problems. In fact, most psychological or physical illnesses can be healed with the help of Jinjutsu. We have also treated animals successfully using this method.

We treat patients in return for donations because we would like healing by Jinjutsu to be available to everybody. However, most of our patients are unable to give for each treatment a donation big enough to ensure even a modest livelihood for our healers and to maintain the treating centers. Many of our patients are without a job, on disability pension, or severely ill, having spent their savings on doctors and medications. We have therefore launched this campaign aiming to collect enough money to symbolically cover the costs of a hundred treatments, which we would use to supplement donations from patients in need. According to our statistics, it takes 20 treatments for a patient to be healed on average, so this hundred treatments would mean the recovery of five needy persons.

It is incredibly pleasing to see somebody get up from the treating table with glittering eyes, or to hear them tell about small improvements in their condition, the easing of their pain, or things they have done that they couldn’t before; to see their faces smoothing out day by day and life returning into their eyes. Tiny miracles happen during every treatment. We would like this to remain available to every one in Budapest and will be thankful for every penny donated towards this aim.

What will we spend the money on?

We are aiming to raise 400,000 forints to cover the livelihood of our healers, the maintenance of our treatment centers, and the administrative costs of our community (banking and bookkeeping expenses, translations from Japanese, etc). Our healers (would) need about 170,000 forints a month each to support themselves and the treatment centers. The money we collect from patient donations is less than that and would therefore be supplemented with the funds raised, thus ensuring that Jinjutsu continues to be available to Budapest residents and that our healers can treat patients on a full-time basis.

Indiegogo enables us to receive the money raised even if we the sum collected is less than the target (although in this case a higher fee will be deducted). All funds donated will be spent on treating patients and administrative costs.

Our donors will be presented with gifts (perks) that they can select on the right hand side of the page. The gifts will be delivered in May and June. Every contributor receives access to our blog in which we write about our daily work, the everyday miracles. On May 31st, in the last week of the campaign, we will be holding a picnic to which all (would-be) supporters will be welcome. It will give you a chance to meet us healers and ask any questions you may have. The exact time and place will be announced later on.

Details

Our full-time healers have left better-paid jobs to practice Jinjutsu on a full-time basis. Since a treatment session lasts about one and a half hours and severely ill patients may need a session every day, it would be difficult to treat several patients a day while holding another job. Healing has become our life: despite every difficulty, it’s much more important for us to see the beauty of ill people getting simply better, in any sense of the word. They are relieved, they are able to speak out, their pain is eased, they walk more easily, their digestion is back to normal, they are calmer. They are more peaceful when they leave, and they spread this peace in the world.

It would be great for us to be able to focus on healing all day, but our community is small and we can’t afford to pay professionals. Hence, we healers deal with the official and financial affairs of the community, arrange internet presentations and take care of most administrative matters ourselves.

Unfortunately, our activity is being made increasingly difficult in Hungary nowadays: we need to spend more and more time running to offices, making phone calls, negotiating. In the past, we used to operate as a Buddhist chuch and were so entitled to collect so-called ˝1 %˝ Personal Income Tax donations as a church, but the current govenrment has deprived us of the church status and, hence, this right. As a result, we can only receive such donations as an NGO, whereby only a fraction of the sum previously gathered is achievable because there are much more NGO’s in Hungary competing for these donations than churches. Hence the need to seek alternative sources of funding to supplement our patients’ donations. We have started a lawsuit against the government in Strasbourg in order to have our church status restored, which we have won: the Strasbourg court has awarded compensation to us. The amount of the compensation, however, is? yet to be determined through a series of negotiations with the government, so it may take quite a while before they are paid. The government has been finding other ways to make our life more difficult ever since: it has also stripped us of our public benefit organization status, and has not been fair and decent towards us during the negotiations either. This has imposed many extra tasks on our healers and even our Teachers living abroad, and left its mark on the operation of our Community.

To our healers, Jinjutsu is also a spiritual path, on which our Teachers help us along. We have been taught that every difficulty presents an opportunity for us to grow, and that every effort made for the Community returns to us and makes us better. We therefore try to consider the current situation as such an opportunity and to do everything we can to continue treating patients and to become, through these efforts, better healers.

If you would like to aid our work and help this beautiful way of healing continue to be available to the patients in Budapest, please support us.

How to make a donation

On the indiegogo site, anybody can make an online payment to contribute any amount of money to the healing of our patients. Since the site does not take HUF payments, the donation sums are provided in euros. One euro equals about 300 forints. Click on the big pink ˝Contribute now˝ button to be redirected to the donation page. You need to register in order to make a donation, but you can do it with your Facebook profile. If you want to choose a gift, click on the ˝Add perk˝ text, select the right amount, and push ˝Continue to payment˝. Following this, check your data and click on ˝Go to PayPal˝ to get redirected to the PayPal site where you can complete the payment with a PayPal account or by bank card (at the bottom right of the page). You can refer to indiegogo's support site or ask us for help in contributing.

More ways to help

Please share this call with your friends so that it reaches as many people as possible. Many a little makes a mickle! (The buttons on the left may help you do it.)

Have questions?

Please contact us here on indiegogo or on Facebook. You may also reach us by email or telephone (+36 20 367 8608).

The first treatment is for free, you are more than welcome to try Jinjutsu.

We thank you for any help!
story_txt:
(Please scroll down for English version.)Közösségünk 2008 óta kezel betegeket a Jinjutsu nevű japán módszerrel, amellyel akár gyógyíthatatlannak tekintett betegségek esetén is elérhető a teljes gyógyulás. Ilyen például a Crohn-betegség, a szklerózis multiplex, daganatos betegségek, de sokak szenvedését szüntettük már meg a Jinjutsu segítségével, akik lelki gondokkal, cukorbetegséggel, gerincproblémákkal fordultak hozzánk. Gyakorlatilag a legtöbb fizikai és lelki betegség gyógyítható a Jinjutsu által. Módszerünkkel állatokat is kezeltünk már sikerrel. Néhány esetismertetésünket itt találod (görgess egy kicsit lejjebb a konkrét esetekért!), statisztikáink összefoglalóját pedig itt.

Betegeinket adományért kezeljük, mert szeretnénk, hogy a Jinjutsu általi gyógyulás mindenki számára elérhető legyen. Ugyanakkor legtöbb betegünk nem tud kezelésenként akkora adományt adni, amelyből gyógyítóink szerény megélhetése és a kezelőhely fenntartása biztosított lenne. A hozzánk fordulók sokszor munkanélküliek, rokkantnyugdíjasok, vagy olyan
 súlyos betegek, akik megtakarításaikat orvosokra, gyógyszerekre 
költötték. Ezért jelképesen száz kezelés árát szeretnénk ebben a kampányban összegyűjteni, amelyből a rászoruló betegek adományait egészítjük ki. Statisztikáink szerint egy beteg átlagosan 20 kezelés után gyógyul meg, így ez a száz kezelés öt rászoruló beteg gyógyulását jelenti. Hihetetlen öröm látni, amikor valaki egy kezelést követően csillogó szemmel kel fel, vagy amikor beszámol apró javulásokról, a fájdalom csökkenéséről, új dolgokról, amit véghezvitt. Látni, ahogyan napról napra kisimul az arca és szemeibe visszaköltözik az élet. Minden kezelés alatt apró csodák történnek. Mi szeretnénk, hogy ez továbbra is bárki számára elérhető legyen Budapesten, és megköszönünk minden hozzájárulást ehhez! :)
Mire költjük a pénzt?
Most körülbelül 400 ezer Ft-ot 
szeretnénk összegyűjteni, amelyet gyógyítóink megélhetésére, 
kezelőhelyeink fenntartására és a Közösség adminisztratív költségeire 
(bankköltség, könyvelő, fordítás japánról, stb.) szeretnénk költeni. 
Főállású gyógyítóink egy hónapban körülbelül 170 ezer forintból 
él(né)nek meg, a kezelőhelyek költségeit is beleszámítva. A kezelésekért
 adományként kapott összeg ennél alacsonyabb, így ezt fogjuk 
kiegészíteni a most gyűjtött összeggel, így biztosítva, hogy a Jinjutsu 
folyamatosan elérhető maradjon a budapestiek számára, gyógyítóink 
továbbra is főállásban a betegekkel foglalkozhassanak. Az 
indiegogo lehetővé teszi, hogy akkor is megkapjuk a gyűjtött pénzt, ha 
nem érjük el a célként kitűzött összeget (bár ez esetben magasabb jutalékot von le). Minden támogatást a 
betegkezelésre és az adminisztratív költségekre fogunk fordítani.Támogatóinknak
 szeretnénk ajándékokkal kedveskedni, amelyeket az oldal jobb oldalán 
választhatnak ki. Az ajándékokat május és június folyamán kézbesítjük. Minden támogatónk hozzáférést kap egy bloghoz, amelyben napi munkánkról, az apró csodákról írunk. Május 31-én, a kampányunk utolsó hetében egy pikniket is tartunk, amire szeretettel várunk minden (leendő) támogatót. Itt megismerkedhettek gyógyítóinkkal, feltehetitek kérdéseiteket. A pontos, időpontot, helyszínt később tesszük közzé.Részletek
Főállású gyógyítónk jobban fizető állásaikat hagyták ott azért, hogy teljes munkaidőben csak a Jinjutsuval foglalkozhassanak. Mivel egy kezelés körülbelül másfél órás, és egy súlyos betegnek akár napi szinten is szüksége lehet a kezelésre, munka mellett nehéz is lenne több beteget kezelni. Nekünk ez lett az életünk, minden nehézség mellett sokkal fontosabb az a szépség, amikor valaki egyszerűen jobban lesz. Bármilyen értelemben. Megkönnyebbül, csökkennek a fájdalmai, javul a mozgása, ki tud mondani valamit, helyreáll az emésztése, megnyugszik. Békésebben távozik tőlünk, és ezt a békét viszi magával a világban.

Sajnos ma Magyarországon egyre inkább megnehezítik a tevékenységünket, egyre többet kell hivatalokba szaladgálnunk, telefonálgatnunk, tárgyalnunk. Ezért kell más finanszírozási formákat keresnünk, hogy kiegészítsük betegeink adományait. Strasbourgban pert indítottunk a kormány ellen egyházi jogaink visszaállítása érdekében, amely eredményeképpen kártérítést ítélt meg nekünk az Európai Bíróság. Ám ennek összegéről nekünk kell megegyeznünk a kormánnyal, kifizetése még sokáig elhúzódhat. Az állam azóta is sok módon nehezíti meg a dolgunkat, legutóbb a közhasznú státuszától is megfosztotta egyesületünket, és a kártérítési perben sem tárgyaltak velünk korrekten. donations as an NGO, whereby only a fraction of the sum previously gathered is achievable
because there are much more NGO’s in Hungary competing for these donations than
churches. Hence the need to seek alternative sources of funding to supplement
our patients’ donations. We have started a lawsuit against the government in
Strasbourg in order to have our church status restored, which we have won: the
Strasbourg court has awarded compensation to us. The amount of the compensation,
however, is? yet to be determined through a series of negotiations with the
government, so it may take quite a while before they are paid. The government
has been finding other ways to make our life more difficult ever since: it has also
stripped us of our public benefit organization status, and has not been fair and
decent towards us during the negotiations either. This has imposed many extra
tasks on our healers and even our Teachers living abroad, and left its mark on
the operation of our Community. 
To our healers, Jinjutsu is also a spiritual path,
on which our Teachers help us along. We have been taught that every difficulty presents an opportunity
for us to grow, and that every effort made for the Community returns to us
and makes us better. We therefore try to consider the current situation as such
an opportunity and to do everything we can to continue treating patients and to
become, through these efforts, better healers.
If you would like to aid our work and help this beautiful way of healing
continue to be available to the patients in Budapest, please support us. 

How to make a donation


On the indiegogo site, anybody can make an
online payment to contribute any amount of money to the healing of our
patients. Since the site does not take HUF payments, the donation sums are
provided in euros. One euro equals about 300 forints. Click on the big pink
˝Contribute now˝ button to be redirected to the donation page. You need to
register in order to make a donation, but you can do it with your Facebook
profile. If you want to choose a gift, click on the ˝Add perk˝ text, select the
right amount, and push ˝Continue to payment˝. Following this, check your data
and click on ˝Go to PayPal˝ to get redirected to the PayPal site where you can
complete the payment with a PayPal account or by bank card (at the bottom right
of the page). You can refer to indiegogo's support site or ask us for help in contributing.

More ways to help


Please share this call with your friends so
that it reaches as many people as possible. Many a little makes a mickle! (The
buttons on the left may help you do it.)

Have questions?


Please contact us here on indiegogo or on Facebook. You
may also reach us by email
or telephone (+36 20 367 8608). 
The first treatment is for free, you are more than welcome to try Jinjutsu.
We thank you for any help!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Janine LaBriola. I am a certified personal trainer with an undergraduate degree in Nutrition and the proud owner of Park Fitness BK, a group fitness and personal training studio  in the Ditmas Park/Kensington area.

For the past nine years I’ve been helping people get into shape, gain confidence and feel their best with one-on-one personal training. I have also  worked as an elite trainer at Crunch gym in NYC and California. 

I was born and  raised  in the Windsor Terrace/ Kensington area and it has always been my dream to open up a gym in the neighborhood I grew up in.   I have a strong passion for helping and teaching others how to improve their quality of life by being consistent with exercise and nutrition. I have chosen to work and start my business in the neighborhood I grew up in because I believe it's a wonderful place  to live. It has a strong sense of community and I want to contribute to the area and see it thrive. I'm proud that Park Fitness BK has become a positive and inspiring part of the community over the past 2.5 years and I look forward to keeping the same level of standards and quality at Park Fitness Gym.

I'm running this campaign to ask for assistance with the last stages of a project that I have been working on and dreaming of for years. I have put numerous hours into researching, preparing and taking action to make this gym a reality. I have the majority of the funds and I'm almost ready to open. However, certain important parts are still needed and are extremely expensive such as  contracting work and functional training equipment.

The Layout

  • The space is over 2000SF.
  • Designated turf area for stretching, calisthenics and personal training
  • Heart rate tv monitors to help you get the most effective and efficient workout possible
  • Cardio machines, free weights, squat rack and strength machines

The Location: Right in Ditmas Park/Kensington! 

What We Need & What You Get

The Fundraising goal is $10,000 for:

  • Contract work
  • Rubber Flooring and Installation
  • Functional Training Equipment (TRX straps, Medicine balls, Kettle Bells, Stability Balls) 

I'd love to show my appreciation for your help! Please select your desired gift when checking out. Thank you!

  • Handwritten thank you note 
  • Park Fitness Gym Pen
  • Park Fitness Gym  t-shirt
  • 50% off first Month at gym
  • Gym Bundle: 1 Initial Personal Training session with Janine or one of Park Fitness' awesome trainers + 50% off 1 month Gym membership!

The Impact

This gym is for local members of the community.  I believe it's extremely important to have a gym in close proximity to your home to make attending on a regular basis possible. With your help, I can bring this dream to life! I plan to open the doors at the end of September.

Risks & Challenges

 We have already signed the lease and  have been working on getting open! There are a thousand little stressors and unforeseen things that arise. Making any contribution big or small is greatly appreciated to soften the blow.

Having years of experience  as a successful self employed personal trainer and 2.5 years of owning a  fitness studio, I'm confident I have the resilience, sound business plan and proper support network to overcome any hurdle that will arise.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • One of my biggest challenges is getting the word out there about the new gym! If you're really excited about this gym and you aren't in a position to donate, just sharing this post and spreading the word to others is greatly appreciated!
  • Please send this link to your friends that might be interested in supporting my dream gym!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

Janine LaBriola

story:
Do You Ever Think About Your Legs?

Seriously. Think about about them for a second.

Think about all the things you do with them and can't do without them.

They are so fundamental to our lives that we take them for granted.  At least those of us who have them do.

What if you didn't have them?  What if there were no medical options for you?

What if we could provide those medical options to give legs/mobility to others? (at a very small cost)

You Can Give Life and Hope

You will be amazed at how little it costs to actually give someone the gift of self-mobility.  I was shocked when I first heard the numbers ("perks" for details).

My dear friend Deborah Berruti is the one who told me about the chance to help others walk and therefore be able to live and to work independently.

Deborah is an occupational therapist at Galmi Hospital in Niger (West Africa).  She does amazing work bringing hope and life to others, and I am excited that we get to be a part of her efforts. Particularly I am excited about her work with prostheses and their plans to build a prosthetic clinic at the hospital.

26.2 Miles - Let's Go!

Each time I lace up my running shoes I am grateful for the ability to get out and move.

That is why on Nov 10 I will be running the Malibu Marathon to raise awareness and funds for simple prostheses and mobility.

You can join me!

Yep. And you don't even need running shoes. (although they are always useful!)

You only need to chose how much you want to support. From as little as $1/mile to $10/mile you can have a direct impact on giving someone the awesome gift of self-mobility.  Could there be anything more encouraging than being able to move yourself?!

Do You Know This Child?

No?  But you can! Get to know her here.  She is typical of the people that you will be helping.

Being in an accident or having a debilitating disease can happen to any of us. 
For a few dollars you can provide hope and life! Through giving:

  • Crutches - While we think of crutches as a temporary assistance for broken limbs, in developing countries, they are often used by amputees as semi-permanent mobility.
  • Velo - French for bicycle.  These are hand-powered tricycles that give those who cannot walk the ability to move. (Here are pictures and an awesome story about one man and his velo!)
  • Jaipur Foot/Leg - These are so amazing! Watch this Video.  Read about them. The engineering and creativity in the design of these prostheses is almost unbelievable.  (note: they originated in India so most of the documentation reflects that. In case you were wondering why there were only Indian patients and doctors in the video!)

It's a Big World Out There

Want to learn more about what life is like as an OT in Niger?  Read Deborah's blog! (be forewarned - her stories may lead you to give up your comforts and move to Niger!)
 

Thank You for Giving, Sharing, Praying & Supporting!

Your support of this fundraiser is such an encouragement to me, to Deborah, and  - most importantly - to all those you will be directly helping. Thank you.

(Don't forget to share this link with others - Wouldn't it be so cool if we actually doubled the fundraising goal!?!)

NOTE:  all donations are tax-deductible.  If you'd rather mail a check, please email me at ebwilson317@gmail.com and I'll send you the info you need.
