story:
Meet ‘Faithful’

Faithful Fiagbedzi is a 13 year old girl from Ghana, Africa. Born with a deformity in her right hand, Faithful has been limited in her mobility for all of her life. At birth she was taken to 3 hospitals because her wrist was turned backwards but nobody mentioned that surgery was an option. Her parents have tried bringing her to numerous doctors in Africa but no one will take her case. The  African Government will not help because Faithful is a just one little girl and why should they care about her, right?

We believe God is on a mission to restore the hand of His Faithful!

Divine Encounters

Jay Adams (Development Officer, DeBartolo) invited Ed Kobel (COO, DeBartolo) to visit Rev. Dr. Emmanuel Eli Fiagbedzi in Ghana to learn more about his King’s Voice Ministry. Ed, moved with compassion for Pastor Emmanuel’s daughter Faithful, knew he needed to help. As Ed began sharing Faithful’s story with a few people back in Tampa, FL, something amazing happened…

Dr. Rick Weibley (attends South Tampa Fellowship with Ed & Becky Kobel) who was born with a hand and arm defect similar to Faithful was moved when Ed told him about Faithful’s condition. Dr. Weibley recommended Faithful to be reviewed by Dr. Garcia who elected to do Faithful's surgery at Shriner's Hospital.

Michael J. Garcia, MD, is an orthopedic surgeon who specializes in surgery of the upper extremity. Dr. Garcia’s clinical interests include disorders that affect the hand and wrist, elbow, shoulder and the pediatric upper extremity. Dr. Garcia agreed to perform the surgery at NO CHARGE!!! Praise God!

A Miracle Waiting to Happen

Meanwhile, Faithful and her family were invited to come visit Ed Kobel and his wife Becky in Tampa, FL. When Ed’s close friend Pastor Jon Farris (Crosspointe Church) heard about Faithful’s condition, he wanted to help too. Together with his team, he launched this crowdfunding campaign to raise the necessary funds to pay for the post-surgery therapy and travel expenses for Faithful and her family. So the total amount of the therapy, including all travel expenses for Faithful and her family, is $25,000.

Internet, this is where you come in: Help God Restore the Hand of His ‘Faithful’!!! Choice your perk and DONATE now!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deets:

  • This is a Flexible Campaign so all funds raised go towards paying for the post-surgery therapy and travel expenses for Faithful and her family. Funds raised above the goal amount of $25k will go towards the work of Mike Warren and his orphans in India. Bottom line: every penny will go towards funding God's work in the world!
  • Grab one of our really cool perks in the right column such as a "Faithful bracelet" or a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Ghana, Africa!

The Impact

This campaign reminds us that God works through His people, through His Faithful. We are His hands and His feet in the world. We are meant to care for each other and to help whenever we are asked with whatever God has given us. For everything under Heaven belongs to Him...we are just His money managers. Maybe there's a part of your life that needs to be restored right now? Trust that as you contribute to this campaign, God's healing will manifest itself in your own life.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
In 2008 Hanna was a passenger in a car that was hit on the side by a drunk driver. The vehicle she was in was flipped over. Two years later, after back-and-forth legal proceedings and a myriad of medical procedures, the drunk driver’s insurance company made her a settlement.


After paying the legal fees and medical bills, Hanna, who had just finished her junior year in college, purchased a used Toyota Prius, her dream car.
The following year Hanna graduated magna cum laude with a degree in rehabilitation science and used her leftover insurance money to enroll in a six-month massage-therapy program in Gainesville, Florida.


On June 18, 2012, with about two weeks before her scheduled graduation, she was hit by a Dodge van whose driver ran a red light. Hanna was knocked unconscious, and all the witnesses except the van driver kept on driving.
The van driver claimed it was Hanna who ran the red light, but all of us who know her know that is impossible. Hanna, who reported that her light was green, is one of the most conscientious and safe drivers on the planet and honest to a fault.


Our biggest concern for Hanna is the continuing pain she is experiencing as a result of the accident, especially from what her doctors call the potential microfracture in her neck. How serious is that? We don’t know yet. But we do know she has to take some serious pain medication.


There is also an issue with her left hip, which sustained considerable bruising during the accident. She experiences a lot of nerve pain in the affected area and is in need of an MRI scan, which alone will cost $1,000. In addition, there are several other post-accident pains and discomforts, the origins of which are not known at this time.


To learn the extent of her injuries and what should be done about them, Hanna needs a comprehensive examination, physical therapy and whatever other related medical treatments that might be appropriate.


Needing to see the situation through, along with the uncertainty that came with it, Hanna moved in with a friend because her lease was timed to her graduation and she could not afford further rent.


Medical and legal circumstances of the accident prolonged Hanna’s stay in Florida to more than a month until a couple of friends came together to get Hanna back home to Austin, Texas. None of her relatives can offer her assistance.


Wanting to start her life afresh, Hanna faces financial difficulties because trying to pay off her looming bills from the accident has left her with only $800 to her name. Since she has no medical insurance, it looks as if just the 20 percent of doctors’ and hospital costs she must personally pay will amount to at least $12,000. Our primary concern is that the injuries may be permanent if she does not get the treatment she needs sooner rather than later.


After learning of Hanna’s plight, we could not just sit back and wait for more tragedy to strike. We have the means to do something, if only to share Hanna’s story with friends and encourage any who can help to donate to this worthy cause. Any amount of donation, from $10 to $1,000 or more, would be most helpful.

story:
As you may well know I am a an Alternative Medicine Cancer Warrior, using natural treatments to cure my Lymphoma. I also have the good fourtune to help other Warriors in their personal battles with this dreaded illness. I have begun to process to grow and produce Cannabis oil for myself and for other close to me for thier treatment.some of these cancer Warriors don't have the means or the time to wait for me to grow and process the medicine myself and most insurances do not provide this treatment.

I have found a producer out of state who is willing to supply us with the oil we will need for two months treatment to give me the time to manufacture the medicine myself. Your contribution will help me and other cancer Warriors many pre-treated with chemo and radiation therapy with Alternative and after care. If you are not able to contribute would you please share my story with others so we may have a fighting chance to beat Cancer.Any contribution would greatly appriciated and thank You.

story:
What are Parkour Utah and EVOLV3 Movement?

Parkour Utah (PKUT) is the largest organizer and promoter of the discipline of parkour in the state of Utah. We believe that parkour is the best and most engaging form of exercise for all ages. Our purpose is to provide a place for community interaction as well as professional instruction to individuals through classes, workshops, and events as well as growth in parkour and other similar movements.

Parkour Utah is a sister company to EVOLV3 Movement. The purpose of EVOLV3 Movement is to be a larger national and worldwide name for parkour.  EVOLV3 has three main purposes: Movement, Community, and Competition. EVOLV3 Movement is the name for the gyms, but they will be organized and run by Parkour Utah.

Purpose of Our Campaign

We are raising funds for parkour facilities across the State of Utah. We are opening the gyms in November 2013. Ultimately, our goal is to provide these gyms as locations for people of all movement disciplines to collaborate and practice what they do.

The gyms will be built even if we do not meet our goal from donations. The money we receive through our donors will be used to fund our initial building of structures. When you contribute you are helping us get the gyms rolling in the right direction, as well as investing in our awesome community. The initial build out will be primitive, but it will be a start for our awesome community. 

Parkour Utah has already made a lot of developments in getting the gyms ready. We have made leaps to organize the community and organize parkour events. We have done research into building design and layout, and made the necessary steps into having our own space for the gyms. All we need now is some additional help from members in our community.


Why Build Gyms?

Here in Utah it is common that when the weather turns cold, traceurs (parkour practitioners) go into a "winter hibernation." Many traceurs either do not have the ability or the desire to train during these winter months. In addition, there can be security and liability issues in doing parkour. Parkour is about using your environment for movement. Thus, in doing it, we might use equipment or obstacles in a different way than intended. This is the case in many local gymnastic gyms, and on private or public property we visit.

An indoor facility will allow individuals of every experience level to train all year round, as well as allow practitioners a safe place to meet up as a community, have competitions, and allow additional levels of progress and growth which outdoor environments generally do not allow. In these gyms, we will provide class instruction (beginner to advanced), large workshops, open gym time, competitions, and opportunities for large group parties.

What Your Donation Helps Us Do

- Build all the structures in the gym.

- Pay for foam pads.

- Pay for a soft floor.

- Contributes to our bar set.

Where Will The Gyms Be?

We decided to start by building 2 smaller gym facilities in Utah to minimize the distance between local traceurs and the closest gym. We will be constructing one gym in Salt Lake County, and the other in Utah County. 

When Are the Grand Openings?

In November, we will have a grand opening for each gym. We want to make each grand opening a party; those who come will receive special offers as well as prizes when they come to the grand openings.

November 2, Evolv3 Movement Salt Lake County Gym.

November 30, Evolv3 Movement Utah County Gym.

More details on grand opening events will come in the near future.

Want to Contribute But Feel Like You're Not Able?

Lots of kids and teens are interested in parkour but might not feel like they will be able to contribute to this campaign. Get your parents involved if possible, let them know what it is we here at Parkour Utah are doing. Educate them about how much you want to do parkour. If you donate, you'll be getting some sweet deals that you won't be able to get at these prices after this campaign ends!

You can also help us out in other ways. Share our campaign with your friends and followers on Facebook, Twitter, and Google+. Also spread the news by word of mouth. Unplug yourself from the Web and let your friends know about Parkour Utah’s Indiegogo campaign.

Unfamiliar with Parkour, Parkour Utah or Evolv3 Movement?

The best way to learn about parkour is to see it in action. Visit our website for all sorts of sweet content: parkourutah.com. Join the Hive, Our PKUT community. Also visit our Youtube channel and watch some of our videos. Connect with our community on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, and other forms of social media. Parkour Utah hosts all sorts of events including jams, workshops, and weekly classes to teach kids and teens all over Utah.

Definitions of commonly used parkour terms:

Parkour: The sport of moving along a route, typically in an urban setting, trying to get around or through various obstacles in the quickest and most efficient manner possible, as by jumping, climbing, or running. Often parkour includes flair movement like flips and spins.

Traceur: A participant in the sport or activity of parkour.

Jam: When a group of parkour practitioners get together to train and do parkour.

Workshop: An organized large class setting to do parkour. Instruction is done usually by rotating stations of different types of training.

Vault: The most basic form of getting over any obstacle in parkour. There are many different types of vaults including "kong," "dash," "speed," etc.

DONATION INFORMATION

-- ROLLOVER PERKS 

Everyone who donates will get our rollover perks. here are the details of each rollover.

- Give us a Gym Idea.

Let us know what you think we should include in the gym. We have lots of cool ideas already, but everyone is different, maybe you can think of something we haven't thought to include. Your idea might also be implemented in future gym designs and improvements.

- Recognition on Our Social Media Pages.

We will publicly thank you on our social media pages. (Those of you who let us know who you are.)

- Free Admission to Grand Opening Workshops. 

When the gyms open we will have lots of fun activities. One of the things we'll have is a 3 hour workshop, from 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM. By donating you can get in to the workshop for free. Be one of the first to use the new gym facility. Other events throughout the day of the grand opening.

- One-Time-Use 10% Off Coupon at the PKUT Online Store.

We will send you a coupon which you'll be able to use at our online store.


--Also

- Any Contributor who donates over the $25 level will recive a New PKUT Shirt


LEVELS OF DONATION WITH THEIR PERKS

--$15-- Pat Your Back and Do a Backflip (if you can)

Give yourself a pat on the back and do a backflip for our campaign.

You get all our Rollover Perks: Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

--$25-- Get A New PKUT T-Shirt

Get a one-time-use free T-shirt code to the PKUT online store. We will be printing the new T-shirt specifically for the Grand Opening Events when we open.

Rollover Perks: Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

--$35-- 5 Punch Open Gym Pass

Gets you one 5 Punch Open Gym Pass ($50 value) Can be used at any EVOLV3 Movement gym.

Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

--$50-- 5 Week Class Pass

Gets you one 5 Week Class Pass ($75 value) Can be used at any PKUT classes.

Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

--$70-- 10 Punch Open Gym Pass

Gets you one 10 Punch Open Gym Pass ($100 value) Can be used at any EVOLV3 Movement gym.

Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

--$90-- 10 Week Class Pass

Gets you one 10 Week Class Pass ($135 value) Can be used at any PKUT classes.

Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

--$120-- First Place Early Bird Pass

Be the First Contributor to get our 10x10 Class and Open Gym Pass Deal. 

You will receive:

One of our 10 Punch Open Gym Passes ($100 value) Can be used at any EVOLV3 Movement gym. 

One 10 Week Class Pass ($135 value) Can be used at any PKUT classes.

For being one of the First people to donate we will also give you 2 additional One Time Open Gym Passes for yourself or for a friend.

Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

--$140-- 10x10 Class and Open Gym Pass

Gets you one 10 Punch Open Gym Pass ($100 value) Can be used at any EVOLV3 Movement gym.

Gets you one 10 Week Class Pass ($135 value) Can be used at any PKUT classes.

Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

--$400-- Host a Party

You get to have the gym all to yourself so you can host a party for up to 12 friends for 4 hours. It wouldn't be a party without food. We'll buy you pizza, drinks, and dessert so it can be even more awesome.

Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

--$400-- Pre-Opening Party and YouTube Video

You and up to 3 of your friends get to come to the gym before we open and have a party for 4 hours. You'll get to play on everything and be in a Parkour Utah YouTube video. It wouldn't be a party without food. We'll buy you pizza, drinks, and dessert so it can be supreme.

We will also include 4 PKUT shirts and 4 single-use Open Gym Passes.

Rollover Perks: Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

What are Parkour Utah and EVOLV3 Movement?
Parkour Utah (PKUT) is the largest organizer and promoter of the discipline of parkour in the state of Utah. We believe that parkour is the best and most engaging form of exercise for all ages. Our purpose is to provide a place for community interaction as well as professional instruction to individuals through classes, workshops, and events as well as growth in parkour and other similar movements.
Parkour Utah is a sister company to EVOLV3 Movement. The purpose of EVOLV3 Movement is to be a larger national and worldwide name for parkour.  EVOLV3 has three main purposes: Movement, Community, and Competition. EVOLV3 Movement is the name for the gyms, but they will be organized and run by Parkour Utah.
Purpose of Our Campaign
We are raising funds for parkour facilities across the State of Utah. We are opening the gyms in November 2013. Ultimately, our goal is to provide these gyms as locations for people of all movement disciplines to collaborate and practice what they do.
The gyms will be built even if we do not meet our goal from donations. The money we receive through our donors will be used to fund our initial building of structures. When you contribute you are helping us get the gyms rolling in the right direction, as well as investing in our awesome community. The initial build out will be primitive, but it will be a start for our awesome community. 
Parkour Utah has already made a lot of developments in getting the gyms ready. We have made leaps to organize the community and organize parkour events. We have done research into building design and layout, and made the necessary steps into having our own space for the gyms. All we need now is some additional help from members in our community.




Why Build Gyms?
Here in Utah it is common that when the weather turns cold, traceurs (parkour practitioners) go into a "winter hibernation." Many traceurs either do not have the ability or the desire to train during these winter months. In addition, there can be security and liability issues in doing parkour. Parkour is about using your environment for movement. Thus, in doing it, we might use equipment or obstacles in a different way than intended. This is the case in many local gymnastic gyms, and on private or public property we visit.
An indoor facility will allow individuals of every experience level to train all year round, as well as allow practitioners a safe place to meet up as a community, have competitions, and allow additional levels of progress and growth which outdoor environments generally do not allow. In these gyms, we will provide class instruction (beginner to advanced), large workshops, open gym time, competitions, and opportunities for large group parties.
What Your Donation Helps Us Do
 - Build all the structures in the gym.
- Pay for foam pads.
 - Pay for a soft floor.
 - Contributes to our bar set.
Where Will The Gyms Be?
We decided to start by building 2 smaller gym facilities in Utah to minimize the distance between local traceurs and the closest gym. We will be constructing one gym in Salt Lake County, and the other in Utah County. 


When Are the Grand Openings?
In November, we will have a grand opening for each gym. We want to make each grand opening a party; those who come will receive special offers as well as prizes when they come to the grand openings.
November 2, Evolv3 Movement Salt Lake County Gym.
November 30, Evolv3 Movement Utah County Gym.More details on grand opening events will come in the near future.
Want to Contribute But Feel Like You're Not Able?
Lots of kids and teens are interested in parkour but might not feel like they will be able to contribute to this campaign. Get your parents involved if possible, let them know what it is we here at Parkour Utah are doing. Educate them about how much you want to do parkour. If you donate, you'll be getting some sweet deals that you won't be able to get at these prices after this campaign ends!
You can also help us out in other ways. Share our campaign with your friends and followers on Facebook, Twitter, and Google+. Also spread the news by word of mouth. Unplug yourself from the Web and let your friends know about Parkour Utah’s Indiegogo campaign.


Unfamiliar with Parkour, Parkour Utah or Evolv3 Movement?
The best way to learn about parkour is to see it in action. Visit our website for all sorts of sweet content: parkourutah.com. Join the Hive, Our PKUT community. Also visit our Youtube channel and watch some of our videos. Connect with our community on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, and other forms of social media. Parkour Utah hosts all sorts of events including jams, workshops, and weekly classes to teach kids and teens all over Utah.
Definitions of commonly used parkour terms:
Parkour: The sport of moving along a route, typically in an urban setting, trying to get around or through various obstacles in the quickest and most efficient manner possible, as by jumping, climbing, or running. Often parkour includes flair movement like flips and spins.
Traceur: A participant in the sport or activity of parkour.
Jam: When a group of parkour practitioners get together to train and do parkour.
Workshop: An organized large class setting to do parkour. Instruction is done usually by rotating stations of different types of training.
Vault: The most basic form of getting over any obstacle in parkour. There are many different types of vaults including "kong," "dash," "speed," etc.



DONATION INFORMATION
-- ROLLOVER PERKS 
Everyone who donates will get our rollover perks. here are the details of each rollover.
- Give us a Gym Idea.
Let us know what you think we should include in the gym. We have lots of cool ideas already, but everyone is different, maybe you can think of something we haven't thought to include. Your idea might also be implemented in future gym designs and improvements.
- Recognition on Our Social Media Pages.
We will publicly thank you on our social media pages. (Those of you who let us know who you are.)
- Free Admission to Grand Opening Workshops. 
When the gyms open we will have lots of fun activities. One of the things we'll have is a 3 hour workshop, from 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM. By donating you can get in to the workshop for free. Be one of the first to use the new gym facility. Other events throughout the day of the grand opening.
- One-Time-Use 10% Off Coupon at the PKUT Online Store.
We will send you a coupon which you'll be able to use at our online store.

--Also
- Any Contributor who donates over the $25 level will recive a New PKUT Shirt



LEVELS OF DONATION WITH THEIR PERKS--$15-- Pat Your Back and Do a Backflip (if you can)
Give yourself a pat on the back and do a backflip for our campaign.
You get all our Rollover Perks: Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.
--$25-- Get A New PKUT T-Shirt
Get a one-time-use free T-shirt code to the PKUT online store. We will be printing the new T-shirt specifically for the Grand Opening Events when we open.
Rollover Perks: Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.
--$35-- 5 Punch Open Gym Pass 
Gets you one 5 Punch Open Gym Pass ($50 value) Can be used at any EVOLV3 Movement gym.
Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.
--$50-- 5 Week Class Pass 
Gets you one 5 Week Class Pass ($75 value) Can be used at any PKUT classes.
Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.
--$70-- 10 Punch Open Gym Pass
Gets you one 10 Punch Open Gym Pass ($100 value) Can be used at any EVOLV3 Movement gym.
Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.
--$90-- 10 Week Class Pass 
Gets you one 10 Week Class Pass ($135 value) Can be used at any PKUT classes.
Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

--$120-- First Place Early Bird Pass
Be the First Contributor to get our 10x10 Class and Open Gym Pass Deal. 
You will receive:
One of our 10 Punch Open Gym Passes ($100 value) Can be used at any EVOLV3 Movement gym. 
One 10 Week Class Pass ($135 value) Can be used at any PKUT classes.
For being one of the First people to donate we will also give you 2 additional One Time Open Gym Passes for yourself or for a friend.
Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.
--$140-- 10x10 Class and Open Gym Pass
Gets you one 10 Punch Open Gym Pass ($100 value) Can be used at any EVOLV3 Movement gym.
Gets you one 10 Week Class Pass ($135 value) Can be used at any PKUT classes.
Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.
--$400-- Host a Party
You get to have the gym all to yourself so you can host a party for up to 12 friends for 4 hours. It wouldn't be a party without food. We'll buy you pizza, drinks, and dessert so it can be even more awesome.
Rollover Perks: New PKUT Shirt, Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.
--$400-- Pre-Opening Party and YouTube Video
You and up to 3 of your friends get to come to the gym before we open and have a party for 4 hours. You'll get to play on everything and be in a Parkour Utah YouTube video. It wouldn't be a party without food. We'll buy you pizza, drinks, and dessert so it can be supreme.
We will also include 4 PKUT shirts and 4 single-use Open Gym Passes.
Rollover Perks: Give Us a Gym Idea, Social Media Recognition, Admission to Our Grand Opening Workshops, One-Time-Use 10% Off at PKUT Online Store.

story:
Quick Facts

$2: The number of dollars needed to insure a child for one year in Ghana

95%: The percent of diseases, treatments and medications covered by the Ghanaian National Health Insurance Scheme (NHIS)

300: The number of kids in Hodzo Ga, a rural Ghanaian village, without health insurance

$600: The cost of providing health insurance for all the children in Hodzo Ga for one year

My Synopsis

For those of you who just stumbled upon this page, my name is Arienne and I have been volunteering in Ho, Ghana for the past 5 weeks. My experience here has been truly incredible; I have learned so much about cultural awareness, medicine, and healthcare in a developing nation. As a fourth year pre-med student studying public health and global poverty and practice at UC Berkeley, I have found my time here to be invaluable in validating my desire to do medical work abroad. 

To read more about my experience in Ghana, check out: gildagoesglobal.wordpress.com

Why Health Insurance

The first patient I interacted with at the Municipal Hospital in Ho, Ghana opened my eyes to the problem of health insurance that is prevalent throughout the country. 

When I met her, Erica, an 8 month old who had arrived at the hospital unconscious and seizing from severe malaria, was a healthy, laughing infant who had been discharged for over a week. However, because Erica did not have health insurance, and her mother did not have the money to pay the 250 cedi (about $170 US) hospital bill, Erica remained in the hospital for 3 weeks after she was discharged. During that time, she once again contracted malaria, a tragically common occurrence due to the large volume of both malaria patients and mosquitoes in the children’s ward.

Unfortunately, Erica’s story is a familiar one. Many children in Ghana, particularly in the rural villages, do not have health insurance. Terrified by daunting medical bills, parents are less willing to seek professional medical care for their children when they fall ill. They then rush them to the nearest hospital when they fall dangerously ill, as Erica did. Delaying professional care not only exponentially raises the cost of treatment, it also increases mortality.

Lack of health insurance should not be such a devastating problem in Ghana. Unlike the US, the Ghanaian government is the sole health insurance provider. Through the NHIS, it only costs 4 cedi, the equivalent of $2 US, to insure a child for one year. 

During the time I have spent at the municipal hospital, at community clinics and at rural outreaches, I have continually felt helpless to make a concrete change. I cannot do emergency surgery to save a woman bleeding to death from a ruptured ectopic pregnancy; I cannot convince the hospital staff to isolate a woman suffering from TB so that she does not infect the HIV patients with whom she shares a room.

With your support, providing health insurance to children in need is something that I am able to do. 

The Impact

Providing health insurance to all the children in the rural village of Hodzo Ga will have a tremendous impact not only on the children themselves, but also on their families and community. Treating malaria, the most common illness during the rainy season, costs betewen 2-4 cedis ($1-2), depending on treatment location. On average, chlldren get malaria 5-6 times a year, making malaria treatment alone between 10-24 cedi ($5-12) a year.

Raising $600 will cover health insurance costs for one year for the uninsured children in Hodzo Ga. Although my initial goal is to raise $600, any additional money will be used to provide health insurance to children in other communities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating isn't possible right now, it would be great if you could help me get the word out! Sharing this site with anyone you think might be interested is a fantastic way to get involved.

story:
Robert L. Cucin, MD, FACS, Sponsor:

I'm a practicing plastic surgeon and a diplomat of both the American Board of Surgery and the American Board of Plastic Surgery.  I received my BA and MD from Cornell, an MBA from Columbia, and a JD from Fordham Law School.  

I've been involved in medical research since medical school, authored over two dozen contributions to the literature, and am an inventor holding 15 patents. 

As a pioneer in power assisted liposuction, I've spent the last 13 years studying fat - it's metabolism, pathology, and methods for its removal, processing, and autografting.  

Broad Impact:

We now know that the gentler-by-design "tube-within-a-tube" power assisted liposuction platform I developed can do more than safely remove large enough volumes of fat to reduce the waist-to-hips ratio (WHR) of patients with metabolic syndrome and improve their metabolic state.  I have discovered that it also can be adapted to the safe removal of visceral ("belly") fat - laparoscopically using my company's patent-protected Endoscopic Visceral Liposuction (EVL) technology and be rapidly developed.  

This new approach is very significant and exciting because it is free of the complications and sequelae presented by current popular bariatric treatments of obesity, involving gastric bypass or restrictive surgery.  Also, the literature suggests that directly removing visceral fat will have a "multiplier effect" resulting in the loss of body fat, the reversal of the deleterious metabolic effects of that fat, lowering insulin resistance and the tendency to type 2 diabetes, and "unlatching" patients from their obese, depressed metabolic homeostasis.

Campaign Goal:

This campaign is to fund the rapid development, prototyping, and preliminary testing of a this important and novel endoscopic device for for the safe removal of visceral fat as this method and device may benefit 1.3 billion people around the globe and help reduce the $350 billion/year expenditure on obesity-related disease.

story:
Baby Bunum December 7, 2010-October 15, 2012

Without warning, Baby Bunum was taken by God's Angels on Monday, October 15, 2012. He is survived by his three older sisters, older brother, mother, grandparents, countless aunts, uncles, cousins, and friends. 

Baby Bunum's family has had to deal with the unimaginable. The loss of a little boy whose heart was stamped on each of their own. A little boy who gave countless kisses and hugs to his mother, sisters and brother. His smile was magical, laughter contagious and presence unforgettable. He has brought laughter and smiles to all those who have had the pleasure of meeting him. Please help us to raise:

$2,000 in FIVE days.

The money raised will be given directly to the family to help pay for Baby Bunum's funeral expenses.

Please open your hearts and your wallet to help us achieve our goal.

Thank you for your help and support.

story:
We the University of Oregon Disc Golf Club have made a resurgence. We quadrupled our membership, recruited a full women's team, and are making progress towards our civic goals.

We are trying very hard to fund-raise our trip to the National Collegiate Disc Golf Championships, primarily to ensure that competing as an Oregon Duck remains open to all students of all economic backgrounds. If we come together as a team, everyone can reach a little farther.

Our team is looking good this year. We have a strong "A Team" and a very deep and talented "B Team." Also, our women's team will be very competitive. We hope to bring some trophies home. 

The Oregon Ducks are currently the top ranked team in Oregon, and we pulled a great victory out in Monterey, CA at the West Coast College Open, hosted by the CSUMB Club.

In short, we could use whatever help we can get. We have a number of fund raising opportunities, but it looks like we will not quite reach our goal. This money would go a long way to closing the gap, and ensuring that Oregon can take our best players, regardless of economic fortune.

story:
Hi,

My name is Maddie Garry and I have been cheerleading with the Surrey Starlets for the last 12 years. It was always my dream to compete at the World Championships in Florida and represent my country and I have been given the opportunity to go (as one of only 3 teams from the whole of the UK) for the second year running after competing last year for the first time! However it is really expensive and so I will struggle to find the money to fund my attendance! Surrey Starlets have won many National titles and therefore will be representing England in America at the World Championships. I have also been selected as an individual athlete to compete with 3 other girls in the group stunt division as 'Team England' after coming 5th last year which was a fantastic achievement and the best that Team England has ever done. Unfortunately we get NO funding from ANY other source and so have to pay for everything ourselves.

The funding will help pay for flights, accommodation and entry fees to compete at the world championships and any other kit I need to buy in order to compete e.g. uniform.

Your contribution, however small, will be greatly appreciated and will help a lot!

story:
MATERNAL HEALTHCARE CLINIC&CHILDBIRTH KIT DISTRIBUTION

FOR UNDERPRIVILEGED CITIZENS IN KENYA 

 

 

<MHI REPORT - English  > 

 If you want more information, please click on the following link :

  http://dl.dropbox.com/u/38617120/MHI%20report_English_prefinal.pdf

 

 

1. PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT Other Ways You Can Help

seven-year-old girl Maroho imagines how her mother would have looked like.

For Maroho, a little girl with no memories of her mother at all, this is all she

can do.

  

Is there anything more important than the birth of new life? But such a celebrated moment dissolves into a distant, sorrowful memory in developing countries including Kenya, as many mothers lose their lives during delivery. According to the WHO’s 2008 Global Health Observatory report, maternal mortality ratio in developing countries is 200~1,000 per 100,000 live births. This is a spark difference to many developed countries (including the U.S and European countries) where the number incredibly shrinks to 20 per 100,000 live births. Developing countries’ high figure comes of low accessibility for mothers to hospitals, unsanitary environment, and low recognition of tacking a good care of mothers’ health.

 

â–¶ Maternal index analyzes health, education and economic conditions for women and children in 164 countries

 

 

< Site selection > 

According to the Save the Children’s report “State of the World’s Mothers 2011”, the mother index of Kenya has ranked 140thout of 162 countries, and major indexes on maternal conditions has been constantly deteriorating in the recent five years. Also, relief activities in Kenya have been focusing on slum areas inside Nairobi. Therefore, FREEMED plans to carry out the MHI project in Kajiado district, which is about 180 kilometers off from Nairobi.

* Maternal condition analyzes health, education and economic conditions for women and children in 164 countries.

      

      / Traditional Masai House

Masai homes are very narrow with low ceiling. They are dark and smoky, as  people  open fire for cooking and heating. Windows are not installed, so that the natural light is not penetrated well. Houses are held up with mud and cow dungs, which increases the risk of getting infected.

     / Hygiene of in Kajiado Dispensarie

Inside dispensary (a clinic located in remote areas), there is only one bed for mother’s delivery-which is very unsanitary. Some dispensaries lack every basic device except for a scale and a hand blood pressure meter.

 In Kajiado, where most Masai tribesmen reside in, mothers traditionally deliver a baby at home with no help from medical professionals.This culture heightens the risk of mothers and babies easily getting infected. Dispensaries are in no better condition. As there are insufficient quantities of medical equipment, mothers are not able to use them in time at emergency. 

 Since 2005, Kajiado has made substantial development with the help of a Korean NGO called ‘Good Hands’. However, there has not been any specialized projects regarding the healthcare of mothers, and their mortality during pregnancy and childbirth is being emphasized as a major issue. FREEMED is preceding MHI project in collaboration with Good Hands.

 

2. ABOUT THE PROJECT

FREEMED deliver Childbirth Kit and Clinic service directly to mothers in Kenya

Small donation, huge difference.

 

FREEMED’s Maternal Healthcare Initiative project is thoroughly planned with maternal mortality statistics and analysis. The project aims to 1) enable mothers in high risks to recognize their physical condition in FREEMED Clinic, and 2) avert infections from unhygienic environments and postpartum bleeding by manufacturing and distributing FREEMED Childbirth Kit.

1)    FREEMED Clinic

  

Freemed Clinic is going to devices for mothers to have a regular self check-up during their 40 weeks of pregnancy. There will be 1) blood pressure monitor(for vital sign check), thermography scale, 2) blood glucose monitor, 3) urine stick (for proteinuria check), 4) tapeline (for height of fundus), 5) Doppler (for fetal heart rate). Mothers and nurses in Kajiado dispensaries will be able to use them after orientation via photo manuals.

With the help from professionals, FREEMED have designed a chart to classify the high-risk mothers. Seven check-up equipments will help mothers to figure out whether they are in a high risk, and this chart makes sure of such a state. (If the mark lies on green, the mother’s status is normal, but if the mark lies on red, she is in an abnormal state.)

The clinic will be installed in 30 sites of Kajiado dispensary, and enable mothers to have a regular self-check up for their health condition. The installed clinic will be taken care by localized NGOs to be run in a sound condition.

 

2) FREEMED Childbirth Kit

 

FREEMED Childbirth Kit is well designed with only necessary equipment for mothers to have a safe childbirth. The Kit includes aseptic cloth for midwives and various items to prevent massive bleeding during the childbirth. Each item can be used easily by mothers for its intuitive design. Illiterate mothers or midwives would have no difficulty to use the Kit, as every step is fully described in pictures.

1000 Kits will be distributed to 30 different dispensaries in Kajiado, Kenya. FREEMED expects to save 2 out of 3 mothers in emergent conditions.


 

3. Introducing FREEMED & The Sketch of MHI in Jan. 2012

FREEMED is a leading independent organization dedicated to working with undergraduate and graduate students with their full creativity to make lasting change in the lives of medically challenged people. Under the organization’s vision “to fill a medical gap in secluded areas and create medical culture of novel ideas”, FREEMED members whom major in various fields in Korea are participating in three departments-Medical, Design, and Management-to eagerly plan and foster valuable projects.

Eight core members equipped with thorough medical knowledge have planned Maternal Healthcare Initiative project for last 12 months. As a first step, they visited Kajiado, Kenya to seek for its application from 26th of Jan. to 5th of Feb., 2012. After a detailed research of medical system and maternal health status in Kenya, MHI team members discussed valuable ideas with local health experts upon MHI project and its way forward. FREEMED and Kenya Kajiado Health Center have signed the MOU. Maternal Health Initiative project is with Good Hands(NGO), KOICA and Embassy of Republic of Korea in the Republic of Kenya.

   

 <Kajiado Health Center>  <Embassador of Republic of Korea      <MK News>

                                                                                        in Kenya>   

 

4. Project Time Line

June 15th        : Close donations

July 15th ~ 17th     :  Manufacturing Kit & prepare Clinic instruments

July 18th~ August 14th  : Install the Clinic in Kajiado dispensaries & distribute Kits directly by  

                        FREEMED members

August 27th     : Report the result &reward supporters

 

5. What we need & what you get

 Please support their first precious moment with your warm heart.

 

One Childbirth Kit costs 10$ each. Installing the Clinic costs 200$ each. In this summer, FREEMED plans to distribute 1,000 Kits and 30 Clinics at various sites of Kenya.

 

   

Required Clinic devices

200$ * 30 sets = 6,000$

Kit production cost

10$ * 1,000 Kits = 10,000$

Total

16,000$

 MHI project aims to help Kenyan mothers deliver safely, and ultimately, to  contribute towards improving world’s maternal death rate.

  

< 52nd Miss Korea, FREEMED honorary ambassador >

 

FREEMED wishes to save mothers.

 MHI project shall make newborn babies to be with their loving mothers.

 Please give your interest and support.

 

  

6. Other Ways You Can Help

 Interested in contributing but unable to donate? Not a problem! Even just spreading words about what FREEMED doing by sharing our IndieGoGo page on Facebook, Twitter, or to e-mail your friends, family, and anyone interested about the page will help. Just click the “share” button and instantly you have connected FREEMED with a larger audience of potential donors.

 And please take a moment to pray or send mothers your positive energy. Anything will help. We would love to get feedbacks and suggestions from all of you to improve this project. Please contact the administrator.

 

7. Contact us

Email: mhi@freemed.or.kr

story_txt:
MATERNAL HEALTHCARE CLINIC&CHILDBIRTH KIT DISTRIBUTION 
FOR UNDERPRIVILEGED CITIZENS IN KENYA 
 

 
<MHI REPORT - English  > 
 If you want more information, please click on the following link :
  http://dl.dropbox.com/u/38617120/MHI%20report_English_prefinal.pdf
 
 
1. PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT Other Ways You Can Help
seven-year-old girl Maroho imagines how her mother would have looked like.
For Maroho, a little girl with no memories of her mother at all, this is all she 
can do. 
  
Is there anything more important than the birth of new life? But such a celebrated moment dissolves into a distant, sorrowful memory in developing countries including Kenya, as many mothers lose their lives during delivery. According to the WHO’s 2008 Global Health Observatory report, maternal mortality ratio in developing countries is 200~1,000 per 100,000 live births. This is a spark difference to many developed countries (including the U.S and European countries) where the number incredibly shrinks to 20 per 100,000 live births. Developing countries’ high figure comes of low accessibility for mothers to hospitals, unsanitary environment, and low recognition of tacking a good care of mothers’ health.
 

â–¶ Maternal index analyzes health, education and economic conditions for women and children in 164 countries
 
  
< Site selection > 


According to the Save the Children’s report “State of the World’s Mothers 2011”, the mother index of Kenya has ranked 140thout of 162 countries, and major indexes on maternal conditions has been constantly deteriorating in the recent five years. Also, relief activities in Kenya have been focusing on slum areas inside Nairobi. Therefore, FREEMED plans to carry out the MHI project in Kajiado district, which is about 180 kilometers off from Nairobi.
* Maternal condition analyzes health, education and economic conditions for women and children in 164 countries.
      
      / Traditional Masai House
Masai homes are very narrow with low ceiling. They are dark and smoky, as  people  open fire for cooking and heating. Windows are not installed, so that the natural light is not penetrated well. Houses are held up with mud and cow dungs, which increases the risk of getting infected.
     / Hygiene of in Kajiado Dispensarie 
Inside dispensary (a clinic located in remote areas), there is only one bed for mother’s delivery-which is very unsanitary. Some dispensaries lack every basic device except for a scale and a hand blood pressure meter.
 In Kajiado, where most Masai tribesmen reside in, mothers traditionally deliver a baby at home with no help from medical professionals.This culture heightens the risk of mothers and babies easily getting infected. Dispensaries are in no better condition. As there are insufficient quantities of medical equipment, mothers are not able to use them in time at emergency. 
 Since 2005, Kajiado has made substantial development with the help of a Korean NGO called ‘Good Hands’. However, there has not been any specialized projects regarding the healthcare of mothers, and their mortality during pregnancy and childbirth is being emphasized as a major issue. FREEMED is preceding MHI project in collaboration with Good Hands.
 
2. ABOUT THE PROJECT
FREEMED deliver Childbirth Kit and Clinic service directly to mothers in Kenya
Small donation, huge difference.
 
FREEMED’s Maternal Healthcare Initiative project is thoroughly planned with maternal mortality statistics and analysis. The project aims to 1) enable mothers in high risks to recognize their physical condition in FREEMED Clinic, and 2) avert infections from unhygienic environments and postpartum bleeding by manufacturing and distributing FREEMED Childbirth Kit.
1)    FREEMED Clinic
   
Freemed Clinic is going to devices for mothers to have a regular self check-up during their 40 weeks of pregnancy. There will be 1) blood pressure monitor(for vital sign check), thermography scale, 2) blood glucose monitor, 3) urine stick (for proteinuria check), 4) tapeline (for height of fundus), 5) Doppler (for fetal heart rate). Mothers and nurses in Kajiado dispensaries will be able to use them after orientation via photo manuals.
With the help from professionals, FREEMED have designed a chart to classify the high-risk mothers. Seven check-up equipments will help mothers to figure out whether they are in a high risk, and this chart makes sure of such a state. (If the mark lies on green, the mother’s status is normal, but if the mark lies on red, she is in an abnormal state.)
The clinic will be installed in 30 sites of Kajiado dispensary, and enable mothers to have a regular self-check up for their health condition. The installed clinic will be taken care by localized NGOs to be run in a sound condition.
 
2) FREEMED Childbirth Kit 
  
FREEMED Childbirth Kit is well designed with only necessary equipment for mothers to have a safe childbirth. The Kit includes aseptic cloth for midwives and various items to prevent massive bleeding during the childbirth. Each item can be used easily by mothers for its intuitive design. Illiterate mothers or midwives would have no difficulty to use the Kit, as every step is fully described in pictures.
1000 Kits will be distributed to 30 different dispensaries in Kajiado, Kenya. FREEMED expects to save 2 out of 3 mothers in emergent conditions.
 
3. Introducing FREEMED & The Sketch of MHI in Jan. 2012
FREEMED is a leading independent organization dedicated to working with undergraduate and graduate students with their full creativity to make lasting change in the lives of medically challenged people. Under the organization’s vision “to fill a medical gap in secluded areas and create medical culture of novel ideas”, FREEMED members whom major in various fields in Korea are participating in three departments-Medical, Design, and Management-to eagerly plan and foster valuable projects.
Eight core members equipped with thorough medical knowledge have planned Maternal Healthcare Initiative project for last 12 months. As a first step, they visited Kajiado, Kenya to seek for its application from 26th of Jan. to 5th of Feb., 2012. After a detailed research of medical system and maternal health status in Kenya, MHI team members discussed valuable ideas with local health experts upon MHI project and its way forward. FREEMED and Kenya Kajiado Health Center have signed the MOU. Maternal Health Initiative project is with Good Hands(NGO), KOICA and Embassy of Republic of Korea in the Republic of Kenya.

story:
UPDATE: March 28, 2011 - We have launched a finishing funds campaign. If you are looking to contribute to the "Flossophy 101" music video, please visit: http://www.indiegogo.com/finishflossophy101.


Our Story

Hi. I'm Cassie, producer and director of the Flossophy 101 music video. In 2005, I brought my regional theater background and non-profit film festival founding experience across the country from West Virginia to Portland, Oregon to work with a start up theater group, but I had ulterior motives. As an experimental video producer for many years, I sought out further education in film making. Over the last six years spent in Portland, Oregon, I was an equipment room intern at the Northwest Film Center for four years before eventually being on staff. I worked every possible motion picture production gig that I could handle to learn as much as I could while meeting collaborators along the way. Last year, a few of us who found ourselves working together often and well decided to create a formal collective, Jabberwocky Productions. Since then, I've been seeking out work, as a producer/director, that has a positive impact on the community, features local talent on and off camera, and allows room for creativity at every step of the process.

When I first met Dave (aka Van Oodles) in September 2010, I responded to his music and loved his ideas, particularly the concept of the new album. His song creation process from conception to execution was similar to how I want to mold my film making process. I was so comfortable sharing creative ideas with him, that I walked away from our first meeting having offered to produce a music video for Van oodles' upcoming single "Flossophy 101." After our next meeting, we developed a script about a man (played by Van Oodles) who comes home and falls asleep without brushing or flossing his teeth. Then, has a series of nightmares where he is chased down by Hal Itsosis, Ginger Vitas and a gang of life-sized food particles. When he wakes up, he can't wait to floss. We shot the beginning of the video in November, but now need your help raising funds to complete the production.

As For me, I am Van Oodles. I make conscious music for kids and families secretly designed to entertain adults. In addition to Flossophy 101, I also have other conscientious songs related to health and the environment, our existence and well being as people. A few examples of other songs on my upcoming album (May, 2011) are songs like: Slow Food, I'm Just A Regular Guy (about eating fiber), Veggie Burger Dance, Garden Of Mine, Neti Pot, as well as inspirational songs like Count On Yourself and One Step At A Time.

As for the video Flossophy 101, its true, only between 10-40% of people floss on a daily basis.  I Van Oodles have been flossing everyday since I was sixteen when I realized how weak my gums had become and how the dentist told me that in order to have healthy gums and clean strong teeth, I had to floss every night before bed.  Its also true that one third of your teeth cannot be cleaned by brushing alone and that other crucial 30% (the tooth surface in-between your teeth and below the gum line) is taken care of by flossing.  Flossing helps keep gums strong and breath smelling fresher. The bottom line is: the majority of people don't floss enough.   Fortunately a fun, quirky songwriting musician and performer by the way of Van Oodles wants to change that. The plan is to make a crazy, fun, entertaining and infectious video that will be released virally to the general public, circulated throughout the dental community as well as various networks like mother's clubs etc. and coincide with Van Oodles' conscious kids album release scheduled for mid May 2011. We want people to enjoy it, learn from it, and pass it on to friends and family and circulate it through their networks and communities. The intention and hope is that this video finds its way into the cracks of people's subconscious and eventually between their teeth and under their gum lines.

Impact

Something fun, creative and inviting like the Flossophy 101 music video is just the thing to making learning a good time. For kids, the video will make daily flossing a chance for daily dancing, not a chore. Flossophy 101 will lead to better understanding of the importance of flossing as well as make children and adults alike more aware of their own flossing habits.

What We Need & What You Get

Thanks to the generous efforts of most crew members working pro bono on this project, and the reduced working rate of Bruce Orr of Mudeye Puppets, (creator of the food particle dancer costumes), the estimated total budget of $5,500 for this video is based on need for:

Costumes - $650
(including reduced rate construction by Bruce Orr of Mudeye Puppets)

Rental Space - $800
(including studio space for building the mouth set)

Sets - $600
(including a life sized mouth set where people sized food particles are flossed out of the mouth)

Rental Gear - $1,000
(estimated for lighting/rigging, cameras courtesy of Amy O'Brien of Purple Macaroni Productions and Sam Naiman of Jabberwocky Productions)

Crew Catering - $1,000

Travel - $100

Insurance - $1,200

MISC - $150

To date, director Cassie Cohn has invested $2,000 of her own savings (originally earmarked for investment in production gear) to create this video. (Stay tuned for video updates from the November set.) Without, at least $2,000 more dollars, we will not be able to move forward with the video. If we can raise the $2,000, we can produce the video, but will have to cut locations and rethink the script. If we can raise the entire $5,500, Flossophy 101 can be created in its original vision. Plus, we have some fun perks including advanced media downloads, personalized songs and videos created for you. Check out the perk list for details.

Other Ways You Can Help

VIDEO SCREENING IDEAS: If you are a member of the dental health community, a kids educator or a creative person with a good idea, we would love to hear your ideas on how to use the completed video and where to screen it.

FOOD SPONSOR: As producer/director, the most important line item and highest expenses in the budget is feeding the crew ESPECIALLY since this video is being created thanks to the time and effort donated by passionate motion picture and dental health enthusiasts. If you are a grocer or restaurant owner and would like to offer meal catering for producer credit and/or reduced rates, please contact me: cassie@jabberwockyproductions.com.

POST THIS LINK: www.indiegogo.com/flossophy101
Like Ms. Farrah Flossit said, "I want you posting that www.indiegogo.com/flossophy101 link on your twitter, facebook, tumblr and every social net work that you're on."

Of course, we like to be a little more polite. So, PLEASE post the www.indiegogo.com/flossophy101 link to all of your social and professional online networks using tools in the "share this campaign" section. PLEASE especially pass this link along to any dentists and any dental professionals that you know.

Thank you for the time you took to read this and your donation consideration.

story:
I am Eileen Castro and April 2011 my husband Sam age 55 was hospilized and underwent triple by-pass surgery. We thought the worst you could hear is you need heart surgery.Well we were wrong. After a week in the hospital they did an xray and then a emergency CT scan. The doctor came in and said we have a incidential find Mr. Castro, you have Lung Cancer. Our lives came crashing down.  They sent him home to heal and to return in 5 weeks for more surgery. In late June a Pet Scan was performed and on July 1, 2011 he had a lobectomy (removal of left upper lung). He was diagnosed with third stage Lung Cancer. He went through 4 month of grueling chemo, which ended the week before Thanksgiving. We were thankful for his life and he was thankful for not losing his hair. Jan 2012 he went through radiation every day for 5 1/2 weeks. Toward the end of radiation he had breathing difficulty and violent coughing. Little did we know the radiation was making him sick. He was diagnosed with Radiation Pneumonitis. He was sick the whole month of March.

 

The Impact

Sam is a loving husband, father and grandfather. He is a kind and generous man liked by everyone. He is a truck driver for many years.  I hope one day he can return to the job he loves. We were in no way emotionally or financially ready for this process. I don't know anyone who is really ready.

 

What We need & What you get

Between 2 hospital stays, ICU stay, 2 surgeries, cancer care, chemo, multiple visits to the ER, unscheduled procedures due to infection, pain, radiation etc. He also had five days of infusion of antibiotic for pneumonia. He saw 5 specialists and multiple medications. The debt just keeps on growing.

I started this campaign to help raise $20,000. The money raised will go towards Doctor and Hospital bills. .

You can give whatever you can afford whether its $1 to $50, it will be appreciated and we will be very thankful for you support.

 

Other Ways you can Help

Forward this website and/or facebook page to everyone you know. Email friends & family ask for help

story:
Hello Everyone!

*Transcrandel Magnetic Stimulation *

I have researched and discovered an advanced break-through in the treatment 
of depression. Transcrandel Magnetic Stimulation or TMS. Which has been 
proven effective in treating otherwise "treatment resistant depression."

*Demon of Depression* 
* * 
My name is Beulah and I have suffered from major depression disorder most 
of my adult life and have been declared disabled because of it! I have 
tried just about every antidepressant on the market in the last 10 years. 
These medications have given me minimal or no relief.

*Depressing Diagnosis*

Therefore the psychiatrist have determined that I have "treatment resistant 
depression", obviously a very "depressing diagnosis" However I am 
determined to fight this dibiiltating condition and not give up!

*200 Of You Giving $10.00 *

Can make this happen for me! As this treatment is cost prohibitive, I only 
recieve limited disability income and my insurance will not cover it! I 
have consulted with The University of South Florida Mental Health Services 
where the TMS treatment is administered. They recommend an initial five 
treatments to see beneficial results. The cost is $2,000 per treatment at 
$10,000.00 total.  I only need you to give 2,000.00 to get me started,as I am seeking other sources for the rest.

So I am asking those of you who can, to help me to recieve the TMS 
treatment. Particularly those of you who have suffered with a depression 
disorder or know someone who has! This dibilitating disorder saps the 
brain of its victims and curtails an otherwise productive life. With your 
help I will be able to live my life fully again! Help care for my family 
and hopefully return to school to pursue an M.A. in social work.

story:
Bootie Camp Yoga

Created by Yoga & Fitness Instructor

Michelle Trabelsi

This class is FUN & will kick your BOOTAY!

Bootie Camp Yoga is an all-level Power Yoga based class, combined w/ traditional Yoga (Power Flow & Balance), Mat Pilates & Resistance Training using light weights & balls, with “much” emphasis on the Bootie!

Bootie Camp Yoga is a safe, non-cardio & slow flow class emphasizing breath & muscle control, alignment & mental focus. Bootie Camp Yoga will help you develop a basic Yoga foundation as well as, a strong, healthy body & mind. You’ll leave feeling strong, physically invigorated & mentally clear. This class will provide you with an opportunity to see the results that your consistent effort can bring & a tight round Bootie in the works!

This class is ALL about the BUTT & Core

________________________________

                                     The Bootie Camp Yoga Project

I have been working VERY hard this year creating an exciting new Power Yoga based class that is called Bootie Camp Yoga. This class is non-cardio, yet VERY challenging, & safely targets those hard to get areas... the BUTT & CORE; while emphasizing breath & muscle control, balance, focus & deep opening of the hips & lower back. Bootie Camp Yoga is becoming an increasingly popular class for both MEN & women.

In just a few short months Bootie Camp Yoga has taken on a reputation of its own. Its popularity has surpassed my standard Power Yoga & Mat Pilates classes, as it's something New, Fun, Safe & offers diversity due to the wide variety of challenging choreography.

Bootie Camp Yoga is taking off so fast that I'm finding it extremely challenging to keep up with the pace of its growth (a good problem to have!). As you can see below, there has been tremendous growth in a very short period of time. I am ready to take this baby on FULL-Time, but need financial assistance to accomplish this, as I continue this journey and make Bootie Camp Yoga a household name. Many people making a small contribution can add up to enough to propel this to its potential. Take a look at my accomplishments in 2012 and then please consider becoming a part of something HUGE!

                               ________________________________

The Development of Bootie Camp Yoga:

 

My Progress...

May

- Formed Bootie Camp Yoga, LLC.

- Filed trademark for name & logo.

- Filed copyright for ALL BCY choreography.

- BCY goes to Sweat Cardio Temecula!

 

June

- 1st BCY Instructor Certification Workshop.

- BCY goes to Riverside YMCA & T3 Fitness!

 

July

- BCY became a National AFAA approved course (Aerobics & Fitness

  Association of America), offering CEU's (educational credits) to

  Instructors.

- BCY goes to Menifee Athletic Club & Power Pros Fitness Temecula!

 

September

- BCY goes to Gold's Gym Temecula!

 

October

- BCY goes to Source Studio in Riverside

- BCY has plans to go to Gold's Gym Palm Desert & Murrieta 

- The filming of BCY Volumes I & II begins!!

- Plans to hit San Diego & LA hard w/ the video clips.

- Submitting package to La Fitness Corporate.

 

To Date:

- BCY has certified 11 Instructors in 4 cities

- BCY is offered in 9 facilities & 4 cities

- Next BCY Instructors Certification will be held on November 18th at

  Gold's Gym Temecula.

 

My 2012 Goals:

- By December 2012, my goal is to professionally film BCY Volume

  I DVD, package & have it ready for an infomercial.

- By year end, introduce BCY & hold Certification Workshops in San

  Diego & Los Angeles, Gold's Gym Franchise.

 

My 2013 Goals:

- By January 2013, my goal is to professionally film BCY Volumes

  II & III (60 min DVD's) & the first volume of Bootie Camp Yoga

  EXTREME (90 min DVD).

- Secure a celebrity endorsement for Bootie Camp Yoga Project! 

- Take BCY All over the nation & internationally.

 

*I have created a menu of Sponsorship options to choose from, offering perks in return...

What your Contributions will Allow:

Your contributions will allow me to professionally videotape my first Bootie Camp Yoga "in home" video series & possibly more.  So far, I have enough choreography for at least five 60 minute videos and two 90 minute Bootie Camp EXTREME videos.

It will also allow me travel to several big cities to start.  As I diligently work on getting Bootie Camp Yoga into the Gold's Gym Franchise & smaller studios, in every big city in the US & eventually all over the world.  There is also a whole other market to target; the people that work out to videos from home!

  • Cost of hiring a professional filmmaker who can film, edit & finish the product, and also clip the video into highlights for potential facilities & Instructors & so I can BLAST the clips on YouTube & Facebook!
  • Cost of professional studio rental.
  • Cost of packaging DvD's
  • Cost of infomercials & advertising.
  • Bulk purchase of Bootie Camp Yoga balls at 1000, instead of 100 so I come out ahead when sellling to facilities.
  • Travel expenses to several big cities in US for pre-scheduled Instructors Certification Workshops.
  • Initial cost of marketing & materials for resale.

story:
Why we're here...

A few days ago, Bobby was diagnosed with an Arnold Chiari Malformation after sudden onset of double vision and intense migraine pain. He spent hours in the ER getting MRI's only to be sent home with incorrect information.  The ER doctor misread the MRI and concluded that it was an "all clear," but the next morning he was called with a different diagnosis...

The radiologist noticed right away, that Bobby had a rather drastic malformation of the cerebellum. The Chiari Malformation affects the cerebellum, damaging the brain by applied pressure from the skull as well as starving the brain of its protective spinal fluid.

Bobby's symptoms are snowballing rapidly since his diagnosis. His vision is impaired to the point of needing to wear an eye patch because of the damage done his right eye no longer works in unison with his left. This causes him to see everything in double, the double vision effects his depth perception, equilibrium, and hand eye coordination.  He has also begun having intense migraines, as well as physical tremors.

These symptoms would be awful and life altering for anyone. However, for a man who has spent his entire adult life working in a profession that requires sharp eyes and steady hands this is a catastrophe. Bobby is a tattoo artist, and a body piercer. And without his eyesight and coordination, there is no way for him to safely practice his trade.

The doctors can't tell us for sure whether or not he will ever regain full use of his eye. Even with treatment and surgery, the damage maybe too far gone. This leaves us with thousands of dollars in medical expenses from the surgery, and no guarantee that this will get better.

This is why we need your help. Family, friends, and total strangers are capable of changing what seems to be a no win situation into a miracle.

And that is what we need. A miracle...

 

This is where he needs your help.

The medical expenses that will be tallied up by the cost of the surgery (potentially multiple surgeries) will easily stretch into the hundreds of thousands. Adding onto that medication costs, cost of living, food, rent, bills which because of his inability to work in this condition, are already beginning to pile up, financially this situation is impossible for a self-employed artist. 

Medicaid is a possibility, though not a guarantee, but Medicaid won't help with everyday living expenses for what is, by necessity, an extremely long and painful process and recovery.

So far, simply by being diagnosed he has already accumulated nearly $10,000 in medial expenses. And this is just the beginning of the road... Bobby has a large family and many people that love him, but even with our numbers we can't do this alone. This is more than a physical impairment to him; this changes every aspect of his life. 

We are only hoping to raise enough to allow him to afford to live his life through this ordeal which is expected to last a year or more just with surgery and recovery time. Because of his symptoms he will not be able to take proper care of himself without quite a bit of help. And depending on the rate of his deterioration, we don't know what damage will be permanent and how much of his life he will be able to pick back up. For years, he has dreamed of owning his own tattoo studio however the doctors can’t tell us for sure if that dream has just been destroyed.

We have set this up with flexible funding, so even if our goal isn't met, we can still use every bit to help Bobby through this trying time. Even the smallest donation helps.

What's in it for you?


By donating to this campaign you will be helping to rebuild a life that may have been altered forever.  Some of the things that we will be offering as perks include thank you letters from Bobby and his loved ones, and updates throughout his treatment so you can see the positive impact you are having on not only Bobby, but the people that care about him. Also, t-shirts that we will be making, and signed photographs of Bobby and his family so that you can see all of the people who you have help with your donations.

Bobby has an extremely large, extremely close family, and when one of our group suffers, we all carry the strain...


We understand that of course not everyone will be able to help financially. And that is absolutely fine. EVERYONE can do something; all it takes is sharing the link for the campaign and helping us to raise awareness by using the indigogo share tools. Tell your friends, tell your family, and tell complete strangers like we are... you can help change his life, with just a few kind words and a click of a button.

Thank you so much, for taking the time to read this.

story:
Over the next 45 days, you will get to know Caring 4 Florida and see the impact of your contributions. We know all too well that when a loved one is living with epilepsy, the entire family is living with epilepsy. We recognize and celebrate the Moseley family’s courage. And, we asked them to share their story with the world. Together, we hope to inspire and motivate other families touched by epilepsy and unleash a personal call to action.

What is Caring 4 Florida?

Founded by Peyton and Holley Moseley, Caring 4 Florida's mission is to improve the lives of those living with epilepsy in Florida through education and advocacy for the use of Charlotte's Web, a non-euphoric cannabis oil. Our programs include sending out ambassadors and lobbyists to raise social consciousness about the cause on a state level. 

Caring 4 Florida was originated to help the Moseley's daughter, RayAnn, who suffers from intractable epilepsy. However, due to the fact that there are more than 375,000 people in Florida living with epilepsy/ seizure disorders, Caring 4 Florida's vision quickly grew to a state wide effort. 

Caring 4 Florida is a registered non-profit in the state of Florida and has applied for 501 (c)(3) tax-exempt status with the IRS. 

What is Intractable Epilepsy?

Epilepsy is a disorder of the central nervous system that is characterized by loss of consciousness and convulsions. Epilepsy can be considered 'intractable' when it is difficult to relieve, remedy or cure, or 'refractory' when it is resistant to treatment. As a consequence of repeated seizure activity and side effects of anti-epileptic drugs, many of these children also have significant comorbidities, including cognitive delay or regression, behavioral disturbance, social disabilities or maladjustment, sleep disturbance and injury.

What Is non-euphoric, high CBD medicinal cannabis?

A well-known example of non-euphoric medicinal cannabis is Charlotte’s Web, a strain of cannabis that has been developed and cultivated for a young epileptic patient named Charlotte Figi. Growers have been able to breed plants that have better than a 30:1 ratio of CBD to THC.  In other words, plants are available that have all of the medical benefits of CBD with virtually no psychoactive ingredient. Called the “hippie’s disappointment”, high CBD, non-euphoric cannabis is not smoked, has no street value, and cannot produce a high of any kind.

How we can make an IMPACT together

Every 4 minutes someone is diagnosed with epilepsy in the US.  Epilepsy can develop at any age and can be a result of genetics, stroke, head injury, and many other factors. In over 30% of patients, seizures cannot be controlled with treatment. Uncontrolled seizures may lead to brain damage and death. 

Many patients have tried all that modern medicine has to offer and they are out of options. Charlotte's Web gives these individuals another treatment option. A less invasive, natural, no side effects option!

However, Charlotte's Web is currently illegal in Florida. Help Caring 4 Florida educate  the community and legislators on this life changing treatment. 

How You Can Get Your Indiegogo On

  • Contribute today. Give graciously, generously, and to the fullest extent that you can. Go beyond "giving back". Invest in today, tomorrow, and hope.
  • Make some noise! Ask your family, friends, and co-workers to help spread the word about our Caring 4 Florida campaign on Indiegogo. Check out Indiegogo's easy to use share tools above.
  • Stay connected. Check back often as our story and campaign unfolds! Connect with Caring 4 Florida through our Website, Facebook, Twitter,YouTube, and/or subscribe to our eNews.

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

story:
I am currently volunteering in Indonesia, by teaching English to children from 4 till 16 years old. I am staying with teacher Philip and his lovely family, which includes his parents, his wife Nana and their three children, Ello, Ella and El.

On the 28th of April, El (Gabriel), the 11-year old son, was hit by a motorbike in front of his school and had to go to the hospital immediately. He needs to stay in the hospital, because he has a big concussion and he needs a surgery.

Unfortunately the insurance won’t cover the expenses and the family doesn’t have enough money to pay for the hospital bills. The person who hit Gabriel is willing to help, but she is not wealthy either. This is why I am trying to collect money for all the hospital fees, so Gabriel can have the help he needs. Philip is devoting himself for his community, by giving free English classes and now it is time we help him! For Philip and his family it really is a huge amount.

Please help me get the money together by donating. Thank you so much!
