story:
COMPANY

Our team is based in the Los Angeles area and Pittsburgh.  We are dedicated to developing innovative technology and amazing products.  Our second product concept Alluris will be a first in class revolutionary product.


The mission of AMD is to design, develop and commercialize new and innovative medical device and drug delivery technology, products, and systems that will provide novel solutions for skin aging and other skin conditions.


Delight our Customers

At Aesthetic Medical Devices, we believe that being healthy and feeling good about one’s personal appearance is an integral part of an individual’s personal wellbeing.  We also believe in a proactive holistic approach to health and beauty.  And, like exercise and healthy lifestyle choices, we believe that people want to experience rapid and significant results in order to be inspired to do something for a sustained period of time.  These basic philosophies drives our approach to product development.

Stay true to our core Principles

In the bigger picture, the AMD leadership team has a strong commitment to stay true to its core principles.  Accordingly, AMD will operate in a socially responsible manner.  As a US-based organization, AMD will strive to employ Americans, and utilize American-made product components and manufacturing facilities whenever feasible.  Moreover, our manufacturing and consulting partners are California based companies.  From a more global perspective, AMD will also strive to employ “green” principals in our everyday business operations, vigilantly ensuring that these operations are environmentally responsible and that natural resources are used as efficiently as possible. 

TEAM AND ADVISORS

Team

Our team members are individually accomplished and collectively have an extremely broad skill sets in multiple disciplines that span all phases of the medical device life cycle from product conception through commercialization:

  • George Hung MS MBA—Former President at Brand Institute
  • Holly Hung—Advertising professional focused on development of video campaigns
  • Arkady Glukhovsky PhD—Former CTO and VP R&D of medical device organizations
  • Wayne Chung—Associate Professor of industrial design at Carnegie Mellon University
  • Jim Misner—Former Commercialization and Marketing executive at several pharmaceutical start-ups
  • Walter Werzowa—Branding expert, owner of music production studio Musikvergnuegen

Advisors

  • Buzz Moran—Former executive of multiple acquired medical device companies including: Spectramed, Medical Research Group, & Percuport 
  • David Sawcer MD PhD—Assistant professor of clinical dermatology at USC
  • Sarah Backhouse— Founder and host of Future360, the leader in championing cleantech storytelling with video

SKINLUMINA

Giving YOU Control

A significant trend in the skin care and beauty market today is a high demand for home use medical devices.  Both woman and men alike want the convenience of a home-use medical device provided it can offer the significant results associated with in-office medical treatments.  Consumers want to be able to use a device that can help them look their best for important moments in life: a milestone birthday, a wedding, or a chic New Year’s Eve party.  Companies are scrambling to meet this demand with more and more devices, but not all devices are created equal.

Microcurrents

Microcurrent devices deliver extremely small electrical currents typically through the surface of the skin.  Applications for microcurrents have been broad ranging from treating general pain and diabetic neuropathies, a specific type of pain associated with diabetes, to treating muscle and ligament injuries to cosmetic skin treatments.  For cosmetic skin treatments, microcurrents can be used to tone facial muscles and manipulate cellular changes within the skin which result in significant improvements in facial contours and reduce fine lines and wrinkles.  Cosmetic office procedures have been used for decades, but in the past 5 years, interest and use of home-use microcurrent devices have increased significantly. 

Consumer Demands

We interviewed dozens of men and women and we received consistent feedback from them.  They wanted to know that their device was working but experienced minimal immediate satisfaction from the currently available devices.  In some cases, the people interviewed weren’t even sure if their device was turned on!  The solution to this challenge is to improve the overall experience of using a device by providing new product modalities that provide immediate, readily detectable actions that improve both the use-experience and the benefits of microcurrent treatment.  To accomplish this, AMD has created a microcurrent device with added massaging and heating actions to increase the amount of microcurrents being delivered while creating a pleasurable experience for the user.  For users with more sensitive skin lower microcurrent power settings will be available, and for users with less sensitive skin, they will be able to increase the microcurrent power.  Again, our goal is to delight our customers and give them the power of microcurrent therapy in a home use device with additional massaging and heating action to provide both a powerful treatment and a pleasurable experience.

SkinLumina Product Concept

The SkinLumina Facial-Toning Anti-Wrinkle Device is specifically designed for home-use.  It is a microcurrent facial toning system intended to address the aging process by a number of means that we believe will include firming and tightening skin and facial muscles while at the same time reducing fine lines and wrinkles.  The device is balanced and ergonomically designed, it has unique electrode configuration, and provides triple-action including: advanced microcurrent, vibration and heating.  Both US Provisional and International patent applications have been filed. 

AMD has completed development of a functional SkinLumina prototype, and users love it.  We now need your help to integrate all components into a stand-alone, easy-to-use, home-use device.  We have the product concept and the know-how, we simply need your help to realize our device and make available. 

Why Indiegogo?  What will the money be used for?

To this point AMD has worked with its industrial designer and engineer to develop the best consumer-focused, fully functional prototype device with a novel combination of product features intended for in home anti-wrinkle therapy, and we feel we have succeeded.  However, the next step will require completion of the development of the device that will be easy to use and cost-effective to manufacture, reliable and of high quality to meet and exceed all manufacturing and regulatory standards.

We are asking for your contributions so that we can complete development and begin manufacturing the Skin Lumina device.  We will work to keep manufacturing and assembly within the USA.  Based on our previous work with our consultants and contractors, we can complete development in about 1 year and we can get our device into your hands soon after that.  In fact, our backers will be the first people to receive our device in time for their next big life events!

Phase 1—Human factors and usability testing  (Duration: 2 weeks)

Phase 2—Complete device and charger design  (Duration: 4-6 weeks)

Phase 3—Mechanical and Electrical Engineer of Device and Charger (Duration: 12 weeks)

Phase 4—Product sourcing materials and manufacturing (Duration: 16 weeks)

Phase 5—Product testing (4-8 weeks)

Phase 6—FDA clearance, Packaging and Shipping to our Backers!!!

Support Us

To support us, check out the rewards to the right! You can also follow us on Twitter@AM_Devices and on Facebook at Aesthetic Medical Devices LLC.

Comments, Questions, Ideas?

Post on the Indiegogo comment thread above or emailinfo@aestheticmeddevices.com

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute at this time then please follow us and consider us for future investments.  Also, please spread the word and share this with 5 of your friends … or all of them!  Thank you!

To this point AMD has worked with its industrial designer and engineer to develop the best consumer-focused, fully functional prototype device with a novel combination of product features intended for in home anti-wrinkle therapy, and we feel we have succeeded.  However, the next step will
require completion of the development of the device that will be easy to use
and cost-effective to manufacture, reliable and of high quality to meet and
exceed all manufacturing and regulatory standards.
We are
asking for your contributions so that we can complete development and begin
manufacturing the Skin Lumina device.  We
will work to keep manufacturing and assembly within the USA.  Based on our previous work with our
consultants and contractors, we can complete development in about 1 year and we
can get our device into your hands soon after that.  In fact, our backers will be the first people
to receive our device in time for their next big life events!
Phase 1—Human
factors and usability testing  (Duration:
2 weeks)
Phase
2—Complete device and charger design  (Duration:
4-6 weeks)
Phase 3—Mechanical and Electrical Engineer of Device and Charger
(Duration: 12 weeks)
Phase 4—Product sourcing materials and manufacturing
(Duration: 16 weeks) 
Phase 5—Product testing (4-8 weeks)
Phase 6—FDA clearance, Packaging and Shipping to our
Backers!!! 
Support Us
To
support us, check out the rewards to the right! You can also follow us on
Twitter@AM_Devices
and on Facebook at Aesthetic Medical Devices LLC.
Comments, Questions, Ideas?
Post on
the Indiegogo comment thread above or emailinfo@aestheticmeddevices.com
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t contribute at this
time then please follow us and consider us for future investments.  Also, please spread the word and share this with
5 of your friends … or all of them! 
Thank you!

story:
Summary

Imagine an experience of savasana where gentle music surrounds from above and below, an experience of dance where the floor literally moves with your feet, or group sound healing sessions where all can experience sound moving physically into the body. Imagine lying on a floor and feeling yourself sinking into it as the vibrations of calming music seeping up from below allows a deeper level of letting go.

We are seeking funding for the first acoustically charged, semi-sprung floor that we are aware of in Austin, or in Texas for that matter. This floor, in a new north Austin yoga studio, will offer a whole body experience for yoga, dance and sound healing. This innovative floor and studio will be part of Sol Healing and Wellness Center, a wellness center currently being developed which will open in February of 2014. We invite you to be part of developing this creative, healing endeavor.

As background, Sol Healing & Wellness Center (SHWC) is the culmination of a ten year effort by Steve Milan, an Austin-area clinical social worker, learner, ecstatic dancer to create a multidisciplinary learning and healing center to serve Austin. For the last 7 years, Steve has developed and run a similar effort in a rented central Austin location offering counseling, acupuncture, coaching and Sol Yoga Studio - a center for yoga, Qi Gong and workshops. SHWC solidifies that effort with an owned property which can be developed with complete devotion to the purposes of community learning, healing and wellness. Mary Nicosia, an acupuncturist/social worker, Kristin Sundberg, an acupuncturist/yoga instructor, and Sean Maher, a musician/sound healer/audio engineer, have joined in to co-create this community. The vibra-floor is the first concrete outgrowth of this collaboration as it incorporates and facilitates healing and wellness at multiple levels.

The vibra-floor will offer a unique experience for yoga practitioners and novices, for dancers and seekers, for clients and anyone willing to open to the vibration. The floor will be designed by Sean Maher, and built by Lakshmi Jackman, a contractor who has maintained an ecstatic dance practice for many years. A prototype of the floor has been built and tested, and the design will now be extended to the entire 400 square foot studio.


What We Need & What You Get

Funding will be used specifically for technology (acoustic disks and amp), materials (flooring, supports, and other materials) and labor required to build the floor and adjust surrounding flooring and fixtures to accommodate the new floor height. This funding is necessary in addition to the funding currently in place to develop Sol Healing and Wellness Center so that this extraordinary resource can be available within our community. Once completed, the studio will be available for classes and workshops as well as to be rented out for community events and classes.

Perks for participation in this fundraiser are as follows:

For $10 contributors,

  • an invitation to the grand opening party for Sol Healing and Wellness Center

For $30 contributors

  • an invitation to the grand opening party for Sol Healing and Wellness Center

  • two free yoga sessions in the new studio

For $100 contributors

  • all of the above plus your choice of a sound healing or acupuncture session with a member of our community

For $300 contributors

  • all of the above plus an acknowledgment of your donation in a special place at the wellness center

For $500 contributors

  • all of the above plus exclusive use of the studio space for two full days of your choice in 2014 (subject to schedule availability)


Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to or may choose not to contribute financially. However, we welcome your help in other ways:

  • Spread the word about this campaign and the presence of our innovative new center in north Austin - Sol Healing & Wellness Center.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to let others know about the campaign!
  • Join us in developing gardens and landscaping on the property which supports the intentions of healing and wellness for all.
  • Come visit us once we open

story:
Hi, my name is Christian Medina and I am a freshman at West Hills High School in San Diego, California. I have a strong passion for distance running and enjoy soaking in the beautiful San Diego weather during my runs! I am fundraising money to help pay for my airfare and hotel expenses to compete at the New Balance Track and Field Outdoor Nationals. My dad will also be joining me on this trip.  I will be racing the Freshman Mile there and look to compete at a very high level. As a freshman, I've managed to maintain a 4.5 gpa and I am involved in leadership organizations, ASB, and clubs. I am a strong believer that hard work pays off and I am blessed to be in the position I am today. At the race, I will be racing the top freshmen all around the nation and this gives me the opportunity to run to my best potential! Thus far, this year has been very successful and everything seems to be working out well. Helping me get to Nationals would be so amazing because this has been a huge goal of mine since the beginning of the season.  I have looked at the costs of the airline tickets to go to Greensboro, North Carolina on June 13-15, which is where the national meet is, and I was stunned to see how expensive they are! I am trying to raise 2000 dollars, which will pay for my airplane tickets, hotel costs and rental car costs! If I do not reach my fundraising goal, I will use the money that I have raised to offset the costs of the trip.  If I exceed my fundraising goal, I will put the excess in an account that my family and I will use for upcoming race expenses. I am very excited to compete at this race and see how I do against the best freshmen boys in the nation! Here is a link to the New Balance Outdoor Track and Field Nationals official site so you can see what the schedule of events are and past results, and read more about the whole event, and even watch my race live: http://www.nationalscholastic.org/nbon

My goals for this event are to be in contention of winning and being recognized by college coaches.

 If you can't contribute money your thoughts and prayers are greatly appreciated. Please spread the word to your friends or anyone who can help! I am super excited and cannot wait to race! Thank you!

story:
In Loving Memory of little Daisy

Little Daisy passed away after suffering from Myocarditis. 
Myocarditis is an inflammation of the heart muscle, and the Infections damaged the heart’s cells.
She was a 6-months old happy little girl. She was smiling all the time, and she had the sun in her eyes.

On Tuesday 16-09-2014, little Daisy was taken away from us in the hopsital after a long fight. The parents and family of Daisy are devastated, and we opened this gofundme account to help them with the medical, funeral and personal expenses.
We know that it won´t bring little Daisy back to us, but we know that it will help her parents, John and Sandra Smith, easy the pain in the most diffuclt part of their lives. 
They just bought their own house, and they can not carry all the expenses by themselves.


We know that little Daisy Smith is now in a safe place in Heaven, and she will always have a place in our hearts.

Let´s pray together for John and Sandra Smith!

PLEASE donate what you are Led to give and know that you will be Blessed for being a Blessing! 

* The Family will recieve ALL funds donated on behalf of little Daisy, and they are very Thankful to ALL who have shown their support and love by Praying and Donating!

story:
Hi! I'm Lindsey Jakubowski, General Manager and Co-Owner of Kriemhild Dairy Farms. I have the absolute pleasure of working with Bruce & Nancy Rivington, owners of EFS LLC grass based dairy farm and Founders of Kriemhild Dairy Farms. Together we're working toward building a sustainable local food economy. We're focused on paying grass based dairy farmers a premium for their quality milk and turning that delicious milk into simple, wholesome and healthy grass based cultured dairy products. 

We've been using a co-packer thus far to make our European-style pastured Meadow Butter, and now we're ready to expand into our own creamery and start churning out more and just as amazing grass fed, fat based cultured dairy products. We're focusing on what we know, full fat cream! Our new line of products will include cultured butter, authentic buttermilk (the kind from REAL butter makers), sour cream, and the most decadent creme fraiche! 

Your contribution will not only help us build a creamery. Your contribution is supporting a greater vision in which our farmers get paid a reliable, fair price for their quality milk, environmental stewardship and animal husbandry. Our employees are able to make a living, truly enjoy the work they do knowing it is intrinsically good. Lastly your contribution will allow us to provide healthy, nutritious and wholesome food.  It's the multiplier effect, one good act resulting in many others!

What We Need & What You Get

We started with a brand and building, but now we need to upgrade and outfit the building with dairy processing equipment. We are obtaining funding from diversified sources, private banks, regional low interest loan funds, small grants and our own equity. It's no small feat and the total project cost is $600,000. 

We're asking for $50,000 from you which will help us start the infrastructure improvements: pouring the concrete floor, vestibule build-out, HVAC, and electrical upgrades. That's 1,000 people donating $50 each. 

We've put together some darn good rewards for your donation; a custom made butter keeper, our favorite cookbooks, and of course first dibs on our new products!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we understand. But please, if you can, help spread the word!

story:
REHYDRADE: The more effective Sports Drink with NO Sugar, NO Calories,  NO Caffeine, and a MISSION to help others.

A most effective way to rehydrate with more electrolytes and more essential vitamins that tastes great without the sugar, calories or caffeine with a mission to assist people in developing countries in need of clean water and to protect against dehydration to save lives.

What if we were to tell you that you can now enjoy a good tasting sports drink that is more effective than other sports drinks but also contains no sugar, no calories and no caffeine while also helping those in need by providing clean water, safe sanitation, protection against dehydration and saving lives?

Well that's exactly what REHYDRADE is about: The most effective sports drink developed by lab scientists and a football coach, experts in their fields that empower you to create change in the world by helping increase clean water access, safe sanitation and protection against dehydration.

How: REHYDRADE is tied to raising funds for inspiring water and rehydration charities that are committed to bring fresh and clean water while protecting against dehydration to the millions still in need around the world.

Become Rehydrated and help others become rehydrated!

Rehydrade is a sports drink with much more than a materialistic value. You can now drink an effective sports drink and make a life saving difference in a developing country!

How it works

REHYDRADE LLC is tied to raising funds for inspiring, impactful water charities that are committed to rehydration by bringing fresh and clean water and oral rehydration to the millions still in need around the world.

By purchasing REHYDRADE during the INDIEGOGO campaign, a charity will receive funds in order to bring fresh and clean water to someone in need. The more you purchase, the more you become part of the change. It's as simple as that!

Charities with which we will be making contributions to are; charity water, the water project, defeat diarrhea and dehydration and the rehydration project.

When you buy REHYDRADE, funds will be given to these associated charities so that they may provide oral rehydration salts (ORS) to protect against diarrheal dehydration, which can cause death; to fund plastic latrine pans and outlet pipes so that families in Central Africa can have safe sanitation for families and provide funding for clean water projects as well.

DID YOU KNOW?

In most rural communities, women and young girls are responsible for walking to collect water for their families. Many times this water is not clean water. Building a water project nearby can give women the freedom to pursue an education or earn extra income. Act now!

Once Upon a Time………

REHYDRADE’s founder, Coach Zack Gottfried worked hot summers in West Virginia while training top flight athletes that later played in the National Football League. He worked with these top flight athletes who were working out in the hot summer sun, sweating profusely and not getting properly rehydrated from sports drinks on the market. The sports drinks they were drinking acted in reverse. In essence they were packed with sugar and calories, thus ADDING unnecessary sugar and calories. Zack thought that there has to be a better way. Zack never liked carbonated beverages, any of them, so he would only drink non carbonated beverages. The problem was that almost all of them contained sugar and calories. HE was drinking these sugary drinks and knew it was not good for his long term health. So he sought out to find a healthier, more effective non carbonated sports drink to rehydrate everyday people in need; outdoor workers, college students dehydrated from late night alcohol consumption, outdoor law enforcement, military, athletes, coal miners, those suffering from flu like symptoms or diarrhea. Zack participated early on in life to “give back” to others less fortunate. He raised funds as a youth for charities he believed in and donated his time to the underprivileged. SO he decided that when he had something that he could develop he wanted to do it to help someone else less fortunate. The dream and vision is about to come true. With the birth of REHYDRADE others less fortunate can realize a benefit too.

REHYDRADE is the answer

After seven years of research and development, REHYDRADE is the overwhelming choice of consumers tested based on its effect and its taste. Its formula has been designed by a football coach and lab scientists who are experts at rehydration. The facts are simple. REHYDRADE is an effective sports drink with more electrolytes and essential soluble vitamins than any of the major sports drinks in the US market. Its test groups have selected it over all competition when compared directly for effect and taste.

 

What are the $$ for?

EVERY REHYDRADE PRODUCT INDIEGOGO PERK PURCHASED HELPS FUND SOMEONE IN NEED

The remainder of the funds raised here on Indiegogo will go toward production. Additional money will go towards marketing efforts to expand eventually internationally.

Manufacturing - We are working with a bottling company and we need the money to get rehydrade manufactured and shipped.

Distribution – Since REHYDRADE is not available in retail stores yet YOU will have the edge by being one of the first! We have had discussion with distributors who are ready to purchase REHYDRADE for their retail buyers. We will make REHYDRADE available on our website by the time you receive your shipment so you can easily re-order and get REHYDRADE delivered right to your door.

Marketing - YOU are the most important link between REHYDRADE and the rest of the world. In order to grow the REHYDRADE project and change the world faster, we need you to tell your friends/family and the easiest way to do that is through social media such as: TWITTER; FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM, YOU TUBE, LINKEDIN and GOOGLE PLUS.

Growth - This is only the beginning. As REHYDRADE grows, we will develop other healthy products containing no sugar, no calories, no caffeine and no fats.

The Plan

We've already been working with our suppliers and we're ready to set off things in motion as soon as we reach our goal. We expect to be able to deliver most of the rewards within two to three months after our project is funded.

All we need now is your support to kick-start the production phase and make this awesome project a reality! 

FAQ

If my question isn't answered here, how do I ask?

Just email us at INFO@REHYDRADE.COM

When will my REHYDRADE purchase be delivered?

Expected Shipping Date: 09.30.2013

We know you want receive your REHYDRADE yesterday! We are working hard to get them manufactured and ready to ship as soon as possible, the latest 9.30.2013.

Can I purchase REHYDRADE as a gift card for a friend/relative training for an event or for the holiday season?

Of course! A special gift card is now available as a perk. Here are the steps to follow when you want to offer REHYDRADE as a holiday gift:

  • Buy your REHYDRADE by selecting your holiday gift perk      in                  $10, $25, $50, $75 or $100 denominations.
  • Email us the name and address of the recipient at: info@rehydrade.com
  • We will send an 8.5 x 11 paper, trim at border, folded in half, personalized and inserted into a standard gift card envelope.
  • Repeat and give to as many people as you want!

What is the shelf life for REHYDRADE?

REHYDRADE like most sports drinks has a shelf life of 9 months.

How will I be able to repurchase REHYDRADE after the campaign is over?

We will be live on line to easily re-order. You can set re-orders as frequently as you like and Rehydrade will be delivered right to your door. We are also working on a mobile application as well. After we launch we can direct you to the closest retailer to you, prioritizing those retailers and distributors who participated with the Indiegogo campaign.

How can I choose my flavor?

Each REHYDRADE is shipped half lemonade/half strawberry lemonade. If you would like only one flavor just email us at info@rehydrade.com and we will honor your request.

Is REHYDRADE available in retail stores?

Not yet, only on Indiegogo for now!

Is there a charge for International Shipping?

Yes, there will need to be an additional charge to ship internationally. It costs more to ship to international addresses. For larger quantities please contact us to get a quote. We'll contact you prior to shipping to finalize details for shipping costs.

If you have any specific questions about your location, please email us info@rehydrade.com

 Join the REHYDRADE Movement! 

There are a few ways you can help:

1. Buy REHYDRADE  

With your purchase, you'll be making a real difference in people's lives.

2. Tell your friends about REHYDRADE!  

Share This Campaign:

Share the link to this site on all your social media platforms. Love is in the movement!

3. Support the REHYDRADE Trend

Every Tuesday and Thursday at 7:00pm EST we will tweet #REHYDRADE to make it trend.  To work, we need your help! Please follow us and re-tweet the message.

Together, we'll inspire the world and make a difference!  

Send a tweet now!

THANK YOU!

Thank you for watching the video and reading about this project. We look forward to sending you your REDHYRADE very soon and we truly hope you will join the REHYDRADE movement and help make the world a better place!

SO he decided that when he had something that he could develop he wanted to do it to help someone else less fortunate. The dream and vision is about to come true. With the birth of REHYDRADE others less fortunate can realize a benefit too.
REHYDRADE is the answer
After seven years of research and development, REHYDRADE is the overwhelming choice of consumers tested based on its effect and its taste. Its formula has been designed by a football coach and lab scientists who are experts at rehydration. The facts are simple. REHYDRADE is an effective sports drink with more electrolytes and essential soluble vitamins than any of the major sports drinks in the US market. Its test groups have selected it over all competition when compared directly for effect and taste. 
 
What are the $$ for?
EVERY REHYDRADE PRODUCT INDIEGOGO PERK PURCHASED HELPS FUND SOMEONE IN NEED
The remainder of the funds raised here on Indiegogo will go toward production. Additional money will go towards marketing efforts to expand eventually internationally.
Manufacturing - We are working with a bottling company and we need the money to get rehydrade manufactured and shipped.
Distribution – Since REHYDRADE is not available in retail stores yet YOU will have the edge by being one of the first! We have had discussion with distributors who are ready to purchase REHYDRADE for their retail buyers. We will make REHYDRADE available on our website by the time you receive your shipment so you can easily re-order and get REHYDRADE delivered right to your door.
Marketing - YOU are the most important link between REHYDRADE and the rest of the world. In order to grow the REHYDRADE project and change the world faster, we need you to tell your friends/family and the easiest way to do that is through social media such as: TWITTER; FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM, YOU TUBE, LINKEDIN and GOOGLE PLUS.
Growth - This is only the beginning. As REHYDRADE grows, we will develop other healthy products containing no sugar, no calories, no caffeine and no fats.
The Plan
We've already been working with our suppliers and we're ready to set off things in motion as soon as we reach our goal. We expect to be able to deliver most of the rewards within two to three months after our project is funded.
All we need now is your support to kick-start the production phase and make this awesome project a reality! 
FAQ
If my question isn't answered here, how do I ask?
Just email us at INFO@REHYDRADE.COM
When will my REHYDRADE purchase be delivered?
Expected Shipping Date: 09.30.2013
We know you want receive your REHYDRADE yesterday! We are working hard to get them manufactured and ready to ship as soon as possible, the latest 9.30.2013.
Can I purchase REHYDRADE as a gift card for a friend/relative training for an event or for the holiday season?
Of course! A special gift card is now available as a perk. Here are the steps to follow when you want to offer REHYDRADE as a holiday gift:

Buy your REHYDRADE by selecting your holiday gift perk      in                  $10, $25, $50, $75 or $100 denominations.
Email us the name and address of the recipient at: info@rehydrade.com
We will send an 8.5 x 11 paper, trim at border, folded in half, personalized and inserted into a standard gift card envelope.
Repeat and give to as many people as you want!
What is the shelf life for REHYDRADE?
REHYDRADE like most sports drinks has a shelf life of 9 months.
How will I be able to repurchase REHYDRADE after the campaign is over?
We will be live on line to easily re-order. You can set re-orders as frequently as you like and Rehydrade will be delivered right to your door. We are also working on a mobile application as well. After we launch we can direct you to the closest retailer to you, prioritizing those retailers and distributors who participated with the Indiegogo campaign.
How can I choose my flavor?
Each REHYDRADE is shipped half lemonade/half strawberry lemonade. If you would like only one flavor just email us at info@rehydrade.com and we will honor your request.
Is REHYDRADE available in retail stores?
Not yet, only on Indiegogo for now!
Is there a charge for International Shipping?
Yes, there will need to be an additional charge to ship internationally. It costs more to ship to international addresses. For larger quantities please contact us to get a quote. We'll contact you prior to shipping to finalize details for shipping costs.
If you have any specific questions about your location, please email us info@rehydrade.com
 Join the REHYDRADE Movement! 
There are a few ways you can help:
1. Buy REHYDRADE  
With your purchase, you'll be making a real difference in people's lives.
2. Tell your friends about REHYDRADE!  
Share This Campaign:
Share the link to this site on all your social media platforms. Love is in the movement!
3. Support the REHYDRADE Trend
Every Tuesday and Thursday at 7:00pm EST we will tweet #REHYDRADE to make it trend.  To work, we need your help! Please follow us and re-tweet the message.
Together, we'll inspire the world and make a difference!  
Send a tweet now!
THANK YOU!
Thank you for watching the video and reading about this project. We look forward to sending you your REDHYRADE very soon and we truly hope you will join the REHYDRADE movement and help make the world a better place!

story:
Our Story

Chace was diagnosed with AML (Acute Myeloid Leukaemia), a rare and agressive form of leukemia, on the 14th of March 2011, just 3 days before his second birthday. This brave and strong little boy has begun an unplanned journey which we are all here to support and help along the way.

 

Last week the once energetic and outdoor-loving youngster was meant to be undergoing a stem cell transplant, because a bone marrow match could not be found, but a relapse of the cancer meant he was rushed back to hospital for a final, intensive round of chemotherapy. Doctors have told the family they will have the results within three weeks and if Chace's condition hasn't improved enough for him to receive the stem cell transplant, there will be nothing more they can do.

 

The Topperwien's need at least $90,000 – and a miracle. See http://www.stuff.co.nz/waikato-times/news/5228716/Desperate-trio-need-miracle for a video about Chace's story.

 

The Impact

Without money and a place on an international drug trial Chace's chances of survival are slim. Doctors say if the latest round of chemotherapy doesn't work, he will need palliative care. But we aren't prepared to give up the fight. Parents Ryan and Keri are desperately fundraising for an emergency dash overseas and frantically searching the medical world to get Chace on a drug trial targeting his type of cancer – and we've got just three weeks to find one.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise about $90,000 NZD in just three weeks! All money goes towards getting Chace a place on an international drug trial targeting his rare type of leukemia.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We only have three weeks to raise a huge amount of money - anything you can do to spread the word and share this campaign on social networking sites would be very much appreciated!

story:
Hello Everyone,

My name is Leah, and I am one of Amy's sisters. I am putting together this fund to try to raise money for baby Easton's medical expenses.  As many of you already know my little sister and her husband welcomed baby Easton into the world on August 23rd. He is a beautiful ray of sunshine with gorgeous brown hair! We are all so excited to have him in our lives! He is a tiny little man, with perfect hands, perfect baby feet and the most adorable ears! We will all be beyond estactic when he gets to go home so we can devour him up with love. Unfortunately, my nephew was born 8 wks early weighing only 3lb 7oz. Because of this he is going to be in the NICU for many weeks to come and the expenses are going to start adding up quite quickly. 

As you all know Amy and Brandon have always been so generous to all of us! I can't count the times that I've talked to Amy about a fundraiser she is participating in, a cancer walk she is doing, a shower, wedding or birthday party that she is planning for one of her friends or family members. She is a wonderful sister and my best friend!  And Brandon, the amount of times I've heard about him dropping whatever he is doing to help his friends and family. He has always been a wonderful husband, friend, brother, son... Their selflessness and generosity to us goes on and on.

My sister and her husband have been there for so many of us without blinking an eye. I hope that you are thinking the same as me and it is our turn to help them. Please take the time to contribute to Easton's healthcare expenses fund. All of the money we raise will go to taking care of their hospital bills and expenses. Everyone knows how expensive it is to be in the hospital for a short time... Being in the NICU for weeks is going to cost a small fortune even with their health insurance. The last thing I want them worrying about are the hospital bills. They need to spend these next weeks  and months taking care of their little man! 

Please spread the word to your friends and family so they can help contribute as well! Feel free to contact me as well.

 

Thank you so much!!

 

Leah Studd

Leah1227@aol.com

story:
Hi, my name is Frank Curia. I work in the plumbing industry and everyday I see what we tend to take advantage of is the basic need of having clean water at our disposal, we can drink it from the tap, bath with it, wash our vehicles with it and water the grass among other things. I felt compelled to do something that in a big way will pay it forward to a community that does not have this ammenity.

This campaign is to assist in my participation with a team to drill wells in communities in Guatemala.

Your specific donation will be used for flight, accomodations, meals, supplies, tools, equipment, and transportation.

Water Ambassadors Canada is a faith based, non profit registered Canadian charity. They take Canadian teams to drill/repair wells, set up water purification systems, distribute water filters and teach health and hygiene.
 
More than 120 teams from across Canada have travelled to Central America, the Caribbean, Uganda and The Democratic Republic of Congo in Africa and recently India to bring clean water solutions to those without.

Where water is inaccessible, poverty is pervasive. Productivity is lost to illness and time is spent walking for water.

Many women spend 20 hours per week collecting water, some walking 7 miles a day, often for contaminated water. Too often the walk is not safe for them physically. It is women and the children they raise who suffer most without water, and who benefit most from access to it.

Water-related diseases cause 2.2 million deaths a year; every day, diarrhea takes the lives of 2,000 children in Africa—more than any other single cause of death. Safe water, a toilet, and clean hands could prevent 90% of these deaths.

Other Ways You Can Help

www.waterambassadorscanada.org

www.water.cc

Spread the word by telling your friends and family about this campaign.

Thank you,

Frank Curia

 

Check out the "perks" to the right for your donation dollars, I hope you like them.

story:
My name is Matt Coleman and I am a rising high school senior in Wilmington, NC. I've played basketball and football for my high school which I have really enjoyed. When I was playing football I noticed some kids with cleats that were old and falling apart, some even being held together by duct tape! Noticing this really hit home for me because I was fortunate enough to know how good it feels to have nice new cleats. I wanted to do something to help them but at the time didn't know how. This need eventually pushed me to start this charity Sports Glory. After talking with local coaches and athletic directors at many different schools they have expressed that they have many students who are in need. I have contacted local stores and they have agreed to give me large discounts on buying these cleats because they know that they will be going for a good cause!

     Now I just need more funds to be able to supply cleats to these student athletes. Normally cleats can run upwards of 80 to 100 dollars and this can be a burden on some families. Getting these student athletes cleats to play their sport will enable the family to use money they would otherwise have spent on cleats for something else they need like groceries or school supplies. Being on a high school football team positively impacts many kids by giving them the incentive and support they need to perform well and stay in school. All donations are going to a great cause and are greatly appreciated! 

    You can see updates about Sports Glory as well as find out other information at our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/SportsGloryNC . Also please share this campaign on your Facebook to help spread the word and get more support!

story:
Each year, under the medical direction of Dr. Rolando De Leon, M.D., FACOG, we prepare and equip to treat 4,000 to 5,000 patients. Our doctors offer a broad range of medical services & specialties. We hope to continue to enhance the scope and the complexity of the medical procedures we can perform, and increase the amount of vitamins and medicines that we take with us. The medical team is complemented by volunteer teams consisting of administrative support, planning, logistics personnel, triage units, and a pharmacy team. Every temporary clinic is set up with its respective doctor and assistant(s) and has the capacity to deliver patient privacy and effective, field-­‐based healthcare.

The medical mission is open to, and welcomes doctors, nurses, and volunteers of all religions, creeds, and walks of life. This is a mission that strives to annually provide the most important tools and medicines that many of the forgotten people in the world need...Hope and Love. 

It began with the vision of a single nun, Sister Lucia, and her dream of providing a safety net for the most vulnerable members of society: the children. In response to the needs of orphaned and abandoned children, La Chia, as she was commonly referred to by the children, established an orphanage in the tiny pueblo of Mindo, Ecuador. In 1972, La Chia and two other sisters of the Divine Providence began to welcome children who had nowhere else to go.

The need to provide the children with an education became a priority and a school was born: La Unidad Educativa Fiscomisional Tecnico Ecuador, UEFTE. From day one, the financial resources of the school were stretched to the limit. Always on the lookout for help, La Chia had a chance encounter with an American businessman that led to an affiliation with two schools from Miami, FL. Touched by the loving environment that they encountered at UEFTE, and inspired by the sister’s mission to educate the children, Our Lady of Lourdes Academy and LaSalle High School were moved to offer assistance. In 1998, an organization called the Miracle of Mindo was formed to help raise funds to support the work of La Chia. Since that time, more than $500,000 has been sent to help support UEFTE .

As time passed it became apparent that there was more to be done. Amanda Gaetan, who first visited Mindo at the young age of 15 with La Salle High School during a summer mission, formed and founded Mindo Futures at the very young age of 19 years old. What began as a young ladies vision to keep La Chia’s legacy and dream alive has today become a Non-­‐profit organization that works and strives year round to sustain and continually improve and grow three different programs under the umbrella of Mindo Futures. The miracles program is a continuation of the Miracle of Mindo. The bridge program began with 8 of La Chia’s students who are soon to be graduating from University. Lastly, the medical mission initiated in 2008, and has been an annual mission since then, providing free medical care and medicine to the people of Mindo and the densely populated province of Pichincha.

story:
Our goal 

We are raising funds for the Mauli Ola Foundation and Ryan Wilson's lung transplant. Ryan's brother Keith Wilson recently passed away at the age of 33; he also suffered from Cystic Fibrosis. Lung transplants are very costly (upwards of over $500k) and most don't have the means to pay for it. Mauli Ola Foundation is a non-profit orginization and introduces surfing as a natural treatment.

 



Ryan & Keith Wilson

 

What Is Cystic Fibrosis?

Cystic fibrosis is an inherited chronic disease that affects the lungs and digestive system of about 30,000 children and adults in the United States (70,000 worldwide). A defective gene and its protein product cause the body to produce unusually thick, sticky mucus that:

  • clogs the lungs and leads to life-threatening lung infections; and
  • obstructs the pancreas and stops natural enzymes from helping the body break down and absorb food.

Find out more about Cystic Fibrosis here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Twjg7v-pTO4

Mauli Ola Foundation

The Mauli Ola Foundation began as a group of surfers who banded together to introduce surfing as a natural treatment to people with cystic fibrosis. Since 2007, Mauli Ola has taken nearly 1,000 CF patients surfing at nearly 100 Surf Experience Days and has now expanded it’s reach with hospital visits and other activities that touch the lives of kids with cancer and a variety of other health challenges. In 2010, MOF was awarded The Agent of Change Award by SURFER Magazine for its positive contributions and example to the surfing community.

The Mauli Ola Foundation (MOF) was organized to promote education, awareness of genetic diseases and to increase research for genetic disorders. The MOF raises funds to support programs for kids and adults with life-threatening illnesses and disabilities through social events such as music concerts, sports tournaments, galas, and other great events. We want to provide a direct and immediate option for children with genetic disorders an enjoyable and healthy way of life through natural treatments. Mauli Ola means "Breath of Life" in Hawaiian.

 

 

 

In memory of Keith 'Sammy' Wilson

http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/york/obituary.aspx?n=keith-d-wilson&pid=158540595

story:
Our Story

I'm a long-time occupational therapist and run a statewide wheelchair seating clinic that evaluates, fits, repairs and otherwise help hundreds of Kansans who are wheelchair enabled ( http://www.srs.ks.gov/agency/KNI/Pages/SeatingC... ). I am also fortunate to work at a residential facility, Kansas Neurological Institute in Habilitation Services, which not only fits wheelchairs for folks with profound developmental disabilities, we also provide a wide range of other assistive technologies that we adapt or build from scratch for folks living here. I've been asked by Dale Huffman, a Certified Rehab Technology Specialist, as part of his VIM* work in Peru, to come to Lima with him and a team of others to spend 10 days at Centro Ann Sullivan del Peru (CASP) to help Peruvian children and adults with disabilities who need wheelchairs, modifications on existing chairs, and in the process, teach local folks how to do these things themselves. The last time Dale and his team went to Lima to provide services, they were met with long lines of families needing help as well as many health professionals who wanted to learn what we know about wheelchair assessment, modification and repair so that they could bring this knowledge to their communities. Dale has asked me to come along to help him meet the overwhelming need in a country full of folks willing to learn and help themselves if given the opportunity.

The Impact

Our team will:

  • Assess and fit children and adults with wheelchairs that give them mobility, health and independence as well as meet with their families to both assist in environmental adaptations and learn from them!
  • Teach local and international health professionals and disability specialists how to assess, modify, repair and maintain wheelchairs and seating systems and other assistive technologies by reaching others through their digital library.
  • Give CASP (check out their website: http://en.annsullivanperu.org/   "to include people with different abilities into life" ) a stock of supplies to continue to provide mobility for children and adults.
  • Visit people in their homes and help them make modifications that give them greater access.


What We Need & What You Get

Each member of the team needs to raise all his/her travel costs; room, board and ground transportation costs along the way; and funds for tools and equipment to donate to the Centro Ann Sullivan. The $2,000 we're requesting would be used as follows:

  • Tools, equipment and associated supplies to bring, use, and donate: $500.00
  • Travel costs: $1,100.
I'm donating my time and covering my lodging, meals and ground transportation while in Peru. I'm also collecting donated wheelchair and seating parts and supplies. Any extra funds raised will be used to buy and bring additional wheelchair supplies and tools so that our project can have a lasting impact. This is a great group of folks and you can be assured that your donation will be going for folks who are being helped to help themselves!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please list this campaign on your facebook page, LinkedIn account, or email this to others who would be interested. All contributions are tax-deductible.


*Volunteers in Mission
story_txt:
Our Story
I'm a long-time occupational therapist and run a statewide wheelchair seating clinic that evaluates, fits, repairs and otherwise help hundreds of Kansans who are wheelchair enabled ( http://www.srs.ks.gov/agency/KNI/Pages/SeatingC... ). I am also fortunate to work at a residential facility, Kansas Neurological Institute in Habilitation Services, which not only fits wheelchairs for folks with profound developmental disabilities, we also provide a wide range of other assistive technologies that we adapt or build from scratch for folks living here. I've been asked by Dale Huffman, a Certified Rehab Technology Specialist, as part of his VIM* work in Peru, to come to Lima with him and a team of others to spend 10 days at Centro Ann Sullivan del Peru (CASP) to help Peruvian children and adults with disabilities who need wheelchairs, modifications on existing chairs, and in the process, teach local folks how to do these things themselves. The last time Dale and his team went to Lima to provide services, they were met with long lines of families needing help as well as many health professionals who wanted to learn what we know about wheelchair assessment, modification and repair so that they could bring this knowledge to their communities. Dale has asked me to come along to help him meet the overwhelming need in a country full of folks willing to learn and help themselves if given the opportunity.

The Impact
Our team will:

Assess and fit children and adults with wheelchairs that give them mobility, health and independence as well as meet with their families to both assist in environmental adaptations and learn from them!

Teach local and international health professionals and disability specialists how to assess, modify, repair and maintain wheelchairs and seating systems and other assistive technologies by reaching others through their digital library.

Give CASP (check out their website: http://en.annsullivanperu.org/   "to include people with different abilities into life" ) a stock of supplies to continue to provide mobility for children and adults.
Visit people in their homes and help them make modifications that give them greater access.




What We Need & What You Get
Each member of the team needs to raise all his/her travel costs; room, board and ground transportation costs along the way; and funds for tools and equipment to donate to the Centro Ann Sullivan. The $2,000 we're requesting would be used as follows:

Tools, equipment and associated supplies to bring, use, and donate: $500.00
Travel costs: $1,100.
I'm donating my time and covering my lodging, meals and ground transportation while in Peru. I'm also collecting donated wheelchair and seating parts and supplies. Any extra funds raised will be used to buy and bring additional wheelchair supplies and tools so that our project can have a lasting impact. This is a great group of folks and you can be assured that your donation will be going for folks who are being helped to help themselves!

Other Ways You Can Help
Please list this campaign on your facebook page, LinkedIn account, or email this to others who would be interested. All contributions are tax-deductible.

*Volunteers in Mission

story:
Focus:

The majority of personal care products out there are filled with ingredients that are harmful to our bodies - not only are they filled with toxic chemicals, but we combine and layer these products onto our skin, (our body's largest organ and the body's first line of defense) without knowing what reactions the different combinations cause.  

What does it mean to be all organic and natural and why is it important?

60% of what we put on our skin is absorbed directly into our bloodstream, so going natural and organic is a must for people that care about their health. The parabens, chemicals, and SLS in many beauty products have been proven to have many negative effects on both the environment and day to day health, so natural and organic is the best choice for us and for the planet! That's why we created the most organic facial range just for you!

 

NO NASTIES

As well as taking pride in the ingredients we select for our products,
we are also committed to those that we leave out; all the 'nasties'.
Crafted without parabens, sulfates, ethoxylated cleansers,
silicones, mineral oil, phthalates, DEA and artificial colors or fragrances.

story:
Our Story

Hello. My name is Kaylie Mitchell. I am 20 years old and I have a pretty incredible mom. 

It is immensely difficult to sum up someone's life in a few paragraphs - especially someone like my mom. Since she was born, I don't know that she has ever let anyone down. It is simply a quality that is innate within her. She has the ability to bring out the very best in people. And for the past 56 years, she has been bringing out the best in her students, players, fellow teachers and staff members, friends, and especially her family. Melinda Mitchell has taught everything from biology and drivers education to coaching the track team and the cheerleading squad. She is certainly a jack of all trades. She is an educator, a coach, a team player, a wonderful chef, a dear friend to many, an awesome wife, and an even better mom. She does so much for every person she interacts with. She gives you her full attention and her word is a guarantee. She will get the job done and go above and beyond your expectations. 

My mom was diagnosed with cancer in her liver and lungs in May of 2014 and since that day, its been a constant battle. Melanoma cancer will claim the lives of an estimated 9,710 people this year. But I refuse to believe that Melinda Mitchell will be one of those lives. 

In her first round of treatments, my mom was administered the drug Yervoy once every three weeks. She received three of these treatments and after further tests, her cancer was ultimately unaffected by the medicine and had only grown exponentially since her diagnosis. Her doctor has since moved her treatments to the University of Florida where she is receiving a breakthrough medicine called Pembrolizmab. The cost of travel to Florida for treatments over the next two years including the cost of gas and the price of staying in a hotel for one night every three weeks will be over $8,000 dollars. Her treatments have racked up hospital bills upwards of $100,000 dollars and those numbers continue to climb. My family needs your help. 

Cancer is an interesting word in our society. It's almost taboo to speak of it although it is becoming a fairly common disease to face in our lifetime. Many believe cancer doesn't have a face. But they would be wrong. Cancer has many faces across the world and one of them is Melinda Mitchell's. She doesn't have to be alone in her battle. We want as many people as possible to join this fight and raise awareness of this disease.  If this campaign is able to save the life of my mom while also saving the lives of others by raising awareness of the signs, symptoms, and prevention of Melanoma cancer, then this project has gone above and beyond its expectations. 

We hope that you join our story and become a part of the fight against Melanoma cancer. Melinda Mitchell has made a difference in so many other's lives and now is your chance to make a difference in hers. 

If you need more information, please visit our site at cancerandmom.com.

What Can You Do?

Honestly, the goal we have set is rather small in comparison to how much cancer is costing my family. We are only looking to partially cover the cost of travel for my mom to receive treatment in Florida every three weeks. That's a 14 hour round trip drive with a stay in a hotel for one night every three weeks for the next 2 years or until her cancer goes into remission. 

But, we are hopeful that we can do even more! Maybe, through the love of so many, we can pay for one of my mom's treatments, or perhaps pay off some of her hospital bills that continue to accumulate as we fight this disease. We offer some very unique and exciting perks to get you involved in the fight!  We hope that you tell your friends and family about this project. We hope that Melinda Mitchell and her warrior spirit become a house hold name. We hope that you root her on from the sidelines and follow us on her journey to remission. With your help, we can get there.

Whether we earn a few hundred dollars or a few thousand dollars, every penny will go to helping my mom fight and beat cancer.

The Impact

My mother is an absolutely incredible woman. She has impacted the lives of countless students, parents, teachers, friends, athletes, and family. She is fighting the hardest fight of her life, and she is doing so with such resolve, courage, poise and strength. But she shouldn't have to fight alone. 

You have the opportunity to change the course of someone's life. You have the opportunity to make a difference - to be a part of something bigger than yourself. I started this project to do what I can to help in a time where I feel helpless. I started this project to dig my family out of a rut that cancer so easily places you in. I started this project to put a face to a scary word. Don't give up on my mom. Join the fight. We need your help. Everyone who gives, shares, posts, comments, or contributes in some way mean so much to my family. You are so important to us. You make a difference in not just my mom's life, but every life she has influenced, as well. 

Challenges Along the Way

Obviously, we will face several challenges on the road to remission. There is, unfortunately, no real cure for Melanoma cancer. But there is new medicine being created everyday that could be the breakthrough drug to defeat cancer. The research they are collecting from my mom could one day be used to save the lives of other families facing the same fate as ours. As she travels to Florida, she takes one step closer to putting this disease to rest - not just for herself, but for everyone else too.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't give? You can still make a difference in Melinda Mitchell's life. Please share this video on social media, through personal emails, or in any other way you see fit. The more shares, clicks, views, and traffic this campaign sees, the more publicity it will receive on Indiegogo. This part of the project is just as important as the financial contributions you can make. So please don't hesitate to get the word out there about cancerandmom.com!

Beyond this campaign, we hope that you become more aware of Melanoma cancer. We want people to know that the probability of you being diagnosed with Melanoma cancer can be greatly reduced through several ways. We want people to become their own advocates. Learn the symptoms and ways to prevent Melanoma cancer at http://www.skincancer.org/skin-cancer-information/melanoma

story:
• Sensor mat slips under any mattress, seamlessly monitoring your vitals and sleep in real time. Uses patented passive optical technology.
  • WiFi-connected bedside unit means no hassle with Bluetooth pairing or even having a phone nearby. Great as a baby shower gift and for monitoring your elderly folks.
  • "Turns your whole room into a sleep assistant" with comprehensive IoT/Smart Home integration (C|Net). Works hand in hand with the smart lights and thermostats to optimize your sleeping environment. 


Sleep Better, Stay Healthy, Feel Amazing.




Revolutionary, ground breaking technology

Juvo uses a revolutionary, fiber-optic based technology to monitor sleep cycles. A patented sensor mat slips under any mattress, making it completely unobtrusive and safe for everyone. You can now sleep without fidgeting with your phone, syncing, or charging any other devices. 

  • No wearables required
  • Real time, unobtrusive sleep management
  • Monitor vitals and trends in real time
  • Accurate sleep pattern classification

What we track


Are you truly well rested?

You may know how much time you spend in bed, but are you truly well-rested? SleepCoach™ tracks the amount of restorative REM and Deep Sleep you're really getting so you can stay at the top of your game, even on dreaded Mondays. Know when you should plan on getting more horizontal time over this weekend.

  • Juvo tracks & manages your sleep so you wake up feeling refreshed
  • Unparalleled insights into your sleep quality every night
  • Tracks Light sleep, Deep sleep and REM sleep
  • Gets your room to improve your sleep 
  • Uses  real-time information on your breathing/vitals to accurately classify Deep vs REM sleep.

 


Better Sleep, Out of the Box
Juvo takes that step beyond just monitoring sleep to helping you actively manage it, even as you sleep. Your sleep is deeply influenced by your sleep environment, including lighting, temperature, sound and more. Juvo can adjust these factors automatically so you can optimize your sleep without lifting a finger.
  • Smart alarm for the perfect start to the day
  • App plays soothing white noise to put you to sleep
  • Works hand in hand latest IoT and Smart Home devices to optimize your sleep



Let your room take care of you

Juvo works with the latest smart home devices to optimize your sleep. Connect to your LIFX smart lights, and it'll adjust your bedroom lighting to help you achieve your sleep goals. Red light in the evenings allows melatonin to be produced, making it easier for you to fall and stay asleep. Blue light in the mornings, even as you sleep, blocks melatonin production, putting you into a lighter sleep so you wake up feeling great. Here are some other things Juvo can do:

  • Turn off your TV using a WeMo switch so you will not be woken up in the middle of the night to terrifying images of The Walking Dead.
  • Talk to your Nest learning thermostat to make you snug in the night, while making sure you won't wake up to a cold bathroom floor in the morning.
  • Automatically silence your Android phone when you fall alseep, and re-activate it when you wake up.
  • Work with your Fitbit so you know how your daily activity affects your sleep, but without the hassle and annoyance of wearing it to bed.
  • Integrate with Apple Healthkit
  • Integrate into the whole wide world of IoT through your IFTTT Maker channel.


How to use it

The sensor strip slips under any mattress. The smart communicator unit sits on your bedside table, and connects to the Wi-Fi network.

What if there are two people sleeping on my bed?

No worries! The sensor strip is not disturbed by movements on the other side of the bed. Both of you want to track your sleep? That's why we have the "Birds of a Feather" set of 2 Juvos!



Color options

The Juvo bedside unit comes in a choice of White and Black, making it a perfect fit for any bedroom decor. We will contact you closer to the date of shipping to confirm your color choice.



Exclusive perks for our backers

  • Be the first in the world to receive a Juvo unit
  • Save up to 30% off retail price (US$199)
  • LIMITED TIME ONLY! TWO PCS GOING FOR $278!


Project timeline


Our Sensor in Action

Unlike other sleep monitors that simply measure your movement using an accelerometer, we use our own patented fiber-optic micro-bending sensor in Juvo. Our sensors are so accurate, it can pick up your heartbeat, movement and breathing in real time. No nightly averages, no extrapolations. In fact, Juvo's sensor is the only one that can directly monitor your breathing waveform in real time, without any contact and without any emission of radio waves, making it safe even for babies. 

The sensor has been tested in clinical studies and the accuracy has been published in peer-reviewed journals. Links to the two papers are found below.

Paper published in IEEE Trans Biomed Eng.

Paper published in Journal of Biomed Opt.



The light attenuates based on how much pressure is on the sensor. The sensor strip is ultra sensitive. By taking pressure measurements 100 times a second, we can sense the mechanical changes in pressure caused by the blood being pumped through your arteries as well as the air being pushed in and out of the lungs.

Our latest production board, with some debug pins and minus some of our secret sauce components ;)


About Us

We are an awesome group of friends spanning 3 continents - Asia, North America and South America - who have dedicated ourselves to bringing you this kickass product. Our team comprises talented designers, engineers, and developers as well as passionate domain experts. 

We are proud to have been accelerated by Plug and Play Tech Center in Sunnyvale, California as well as The Co-Foundry in Singapore. 

    

Tan Toi Ngee - Product
Mah Chern Wern - Design
Mariano Martinez - Software
Zhihao - Research Scientist
Jupe Tan - Partnerships
Vishal G - Firmware & hardware
Tejas - Smartphone apps
Lionel Sim - Marketing
Louis - Healthcare expert

Risks and challenges

Technical challenges: 

Designing an experience this simple is very difficult, but we've overcome the major obstacles. The revolutionary fiber optic sensor is something that has never been done before for a consumer grade device. The scientists and researchers have been working on the technology for the past 5 years, and the product team has been refining it for over a year. In the last year, we have built 3 generations of prototypes, iterating each time to produce a simpler, more reliable product. Shipping a product like this always comes with unforeseen challenges, but whatever they are, our team is ready.

Delivery: 

We have stated delivery to be in March 2016, and we have scoped out our component suppliers and manufacturing lead time. However, it is impossible to account for every scenario due to practicality. Nevertheless, we have set a conservative goal, and the bulk of iterations are already completed,

story:
Our Work

In 2007, The Doula Project created a model of care that seeks to advance a new vision of holistic pregnancy support: a doula for all reproductive choices. Since that time, our organization has grown from two to more than 75 volunteer doulas. These doulas have provided compassionate, respectful support to more than 30,000 pregnant people in NYC, and operate under the guiding principle that all people deserve compassion, care, and support, whether they choose abortion, adoption, or to raise their child.

Our Wishlist

Our fall online fundraising campaign honors the decisions people make in their reproductive lives. Our fall campaign features our wish list representing crucial services that The Doula Project provides to our clients and needed support for the organization. Please consider supporting The Doula Project by picking an item from our wish list!

The Details

All contributions are tax-deductible and can be made via our campaign page where you can track our progress towards our $5,000 fundraising goal. If you would like to make your gift in honor of someone special, please email your request to doulaprojectbod@gmail.com.

We are incredibly grateful to the volunteers who make The Doula Project run, and to our donors and supporters who allow us to do this great work. 

Thank you,

The Doula Project
story_txt:
Our Work 
In 2007, The Doula Project created a model of care that seeks to advance a new vision of
holistic pregnancy support: a doula for all reproductive choices. Since that
time, our organization has grown from two to more than 75 volunteer doulas.
These doulas have provided compassionate, respectful support to more than 30,000 pregnant people in NYC, and operate under the guiding principle that all
people deserve compassion, care, and support, whether they choose abortion, adoption, or to raise their child.
   Our Wishlist 

Our fall online fundraising
campaign honors the decisions people make in their reproductive lives. Our
fall campaign features our wish list representing crucial services that The
Doula Project provides to our clients and needed support for the organization.
Please consider supporting The Doula Project by picking an item from our wish
list!

The Details


All contributions are tax-deductible and can be
made via our campaign
page where you can track our progress towards our $5,000 fundraising
goal. If you would like to make your gift in honor of someone special, please
email your request to doulaprojectbod@gmail.com.

We are incredibly grateful to the volunteers who
make The Doula Project run, and to our donors and supporters who allow us to do
this great work.  
Thank you,
The Doula
Project

story:
Short Summary

We are The Boxing Gym West Seattle, a boxing school taught by a featherweight with a big heart named Coach Lee. A year ago we were all strangers to each other; now we're a boxing family. We are a true reflection of the diversity that surrounds us. Our gym provides a home for those who seek to discover themselves through the sweet science. Students come from all walks of life-from the street to the college educated. The school has become a pillar on which they can rely. Our goal is to continue to enrich our neighborhood by offering unique learning opportunities and warm, welcoming community. 

 A couple of months ago we were training outdoors with no equipment. With overwhelming support from the community, some perseverance in pursuing a dream, and a shoe string budget, we finally found our new home. We are just about all settled in and just need a few finishing touches to make our home complete, starting with the Ring! This would give us a safe and appropriate space for sparring and the ability to take our practice to the next level. 


What We Need & What You Get

The Investment for the Ring is $3000.

Our additional stretch goals in order to make our gym more complete are:

 Bag Hangers to be hung on either side of the ring $1300

Kettlebells for rad new classes that compliment our current class offering $1200

Mats for flooring $450

Speed Bag $250

Campaign fees are dependent on the amount we are able to raise, so some of this money will go to cover that expense.

If we do not raise the full amount for all of our goals, the money that is contributed will go toward purchasing each item of equipment in the order that they are listed, starting with the Ring.

Perks:

$10 A "thank you" on our website

$25 A sticker of our logo 

$50 T-shirt of limited printing designed for this campaign

$100 Zip-up hoodie of limited printing for this campaign

$250 A specially scheduled Boxing Bootcamp, plus the shoutout, sticker, campaign t-shirt and campaign zip-up. You get to choose from one of two Saturday mornings. You are also welcome to gift this class.

The Impact

Your support helps us to continue to come together in a positive way-for our physical, mental and spiritual well being. It also helps a local, veteran owned business continue to offer a service about which all involved are very passionate. Many of our neighbors have already expressed that our presence is a much needed breath of fresh air. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that some people may not be in a position to make a monetary contribution. Please consider sharing this campaign with others through email and/or your social media sites. Every little bit helps. Thank you!

story:
Hello America! 
It's been pretty hard to ignore all of the Ice Bucket Challenges that have been gracing the pages of our social media outlets and making waves on TV lately.  It seems like EVERYWHERE you look celebrities, college students, office mates and everyday people are dumping huge buckets of ice water over their heads to raise awareness for ALS (more commonly known as Lou Gehrig's Disease). 
Well, quite frankly, I'm not all that excited about it! OK...at first I was...
It's GREAT that better knowledge about this disease is being spread with the fervor of a fire, and it's GREAT that so many people are getting involved, but I THOUGHT they were doing it to raise money.  Then I realized they were doing it OR donating money.  
So in true Jacque style, I decided to call out and challenge my friends, and their friends, and their friends friends to just plain DONATE and for a little incentive, I'm offering to jump in the OCEAN.  
Here's the catch though...my situation isn't quite like those of you who live in the contiguous 48 states.  I live in Alaska, and I work in the Oil Fields of Prudhoe Bay.  Right now, in the MIDDLE OF SUMMER, we've got a high of 45 degrees.  So you see, I'm not talking about a warm east or west coast ocean dip...I'm talking about an ARCTIC OCEAN Polar Bear PLUNGE!!!  
If we can raise $1,000.00 I'll regular Ice Bucket Challenge...$5,000.00 and I'll go out Polar Bear Style. 
So wish me luck and GIMME MONEY AMERICA!!!

story:
Mission Statement: Passionate triathlete interested in raising funds for young adult athletes who suffer from SUDDEN CARDIAC ARREST. Goal to raise awareness and increase the number of Automated External Defibrillator (AED) in high schools around Cincinnati. 


Personal Story: My younger brother Joshua Patty suffered from life threatening sudden cardiac arrest in the fall of 2013 on October 21st. Josh was a Senior on the Varsity Swim Team at Elder High School when a routine dryland practice turned his life around. He had been working out with the team and felt extremely light-headed before collapsing on the gym floor. EMS arrived as fast as possible and delivered life saving care to my little brother until his heartbeat returned after 8-10 minutes. Josh was rushed to University Hospital where he was placed in an induced coma to save his life. Doctors gave us a realistic survival percentage of 25% and we rallied together in support for him. 

After 3 harrowing days in a coma, and with the prayers/support of his family and friends, Josh pulled through miraculously! Two more weeks were needed in the hospital for memory and physical therapy and with care of amazing doctors/nurses my little brother returned to us. A defibrillator was put into his chest to prevent future accidents and Josh is now actively involved at Cincinnati State Community College studying construction management. Josh definitely enjoys his time there and is looking forward to a bright/healthy future! 

If not for the quick decisions of emergency health professionals from Price Hill and University Hospital, my brother may not be alive today! That is why I am doing this race, to raise awareness, honor my younger brother along with people who have passed from SCA, and add value to AHA research that is currently being done. 

Race Day: I will compete in the Half Ironman (1.2 mi. swim, 56 mi. bike, 13.1 mi. run) in a goal time under 6 hours on July 11th, 2015. The race will be dedicated to my younger brother, all of those who have suffered or passed away from this disease and the many dedicated sponsors who will help me out along the way.

Funding Needs ($2000): The first $1500 goes towards The American Heart Association for innovative research on Sudden Cardiac Arrest in young adults. $500 to help subsidize Muncie, Indiana's Half-Ironman racing fee ($260) along with various equipment and hotel ($240)

Stats: 

1.  92% of Sudden Cardiac Arrest Victims do not survive.

2.  The number of people who die each year from SCA isroughly equivalent to the number who die from Alzheimer's disease, assault with firearms, breast cancer, and cervical cancer during a year.        

   3.  In the U.S. alone, approximately 424,000 people of all ages experience EMS-assessed out-of-hospital non-traumatic SCA each year (more than 1,000/day) and 9 out of 10 victims die.

  4.  In 2013, the American Heart Association (AHA) reported there are 9,500 cases of EMS-assessed OHCA annually in youth under 18.


HELP US FIGHT SUDDEN CARDIAC ARREST AND SUPPORT OUR RACE FOR THE CURE!!!!

story:
Leeland was born at 35 weeks by c-section on July 28, 2014. He was life flighted to Children's hospital. Since his birth he has been in and out of Children's. He has undergone several surgeries. He has had open heart on October 15, 2014 and most recently spinal cord surgery in Feb of 2015. He has more surgeries in his future, with reconstructive bowel surgery to remove the colostomy bag he has had since birth.

Leelands parents are in need of this help as his father lost his job having to have him at the doctors or hospital 3 times a week.

All money is to help with Leelands medical expenses and to help the family keep a house over their head as his father is trying to find a job and that will work with his schedule of appointnts for his son.
